# Helsingin Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan pöytäkirja 11.03.2025

#### §123: Lönnrotinkadun nastarengaskieltokokeilun vaikutusten arviointi ja jatkosta päättäminen

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta käsitteli Lönnrotinkadulla syksyllä 2022 alkaneen nastarengaskieltokokeilun vaikutuksia ja sen jatkoa. Kokeilun tavoitteena on ollut vähentää katupölyä ja parantaa ilmanlaatua, sillä hengitettävien hiukkasten pitoisuudet ylittävät EU:n uudet raja-arvot. Nykyinen kielto, joka salli asioinnin kiinteistöissä nastarenkailla, on osoittautunut vaikeaksi valvoa ja nastarenkaiden osuus on laskenut vain 70 prosentista noin 45 prosenttiin. Esityksessä ehdotettiin kokeilun jatkamista kolmella vuodella siten, että asioinnin salliva lisäkilpi poistetaan, mikä helpottaisi valvontaa ja tekisi kiellosta tehokkaamman. Tiukennuksen arvioitiin lisäävän liikenteen siirtymistä ja vaikeuttavan pysäköintiä, mutta kokonaisvaikutusten arvioitiin olevan vähäisiä.

Vote Asia pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti Mika Raatikaisen ehdotuksesta.

#### §124: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan esitys kaupunginhallitukselle tonttien varaamiseksi asuntohankkeita varten

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta esitti kaupunginhallitukselle useiden tonttien varaamista asuntohankkeita varten eri puolilta Helsinkiä. Varausesitys koski tontteja kaupungin asuntotuotantopalvelulle (Att), hintakilpailuihin, konsepti- ja/tai hintakilpailuun, Kehittyvä kerrostalo -tonttihakuun sekä Helsingin Velvoitepysäköinti Oy:lle pysäköintitontteja varten. Esityksen tavoitteena on varmistaa riittävä asuntotuotanto ja edistää asumisen ja siihen liittyvän maankäytön toteutusohjelman (AM-ohjelma) mukaisia hallinta- ja rahoitusmuotojen tavoitteita sekä ehkäistä segregaatiota. Varausesitys mahdollistaa yhteensä noin 1323 asunnon tuotannon. Lautakunta esitti kaupunginhallitukselle oikeuttaa tonttipäällikön ja lautakunnan järjestämään kilpailut ja valitsemaan varauksensaajat tietyin ehdoin.

#### §125: Etu-Töölö, Hiekkarannantie 16, poikkeamishakemus

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta käsitteli poikkeamishakemusta, joka koski sauna-, ravintola- ja vesiurheilutoimintaa yhdistävän rakennuskokonaisuuden rakentamista Hiekkarannantie 16:een. Hanke poikkeaa voimassa olevista asemakaavoista muun muassa rakennusoikeuden määrän, rakennusalan rajojen, kattomuodon, terassin ja laiturin sijainnin sekä jätehuollon sijoittelun osalta. Hakija perusteli poikkeamista hankkeen toiminnallisella ja kaupallisella toteuttamiskelpoisuudella, arkkitehtonisella laadulla ja alueen virkistystoiminnan rikastuttamisella. Muistutuksissa esitettiin huolta toimintojen sopivuudesta hautausmaan läheisyyteen ja poikkeamien merkittävyydestä. Lautakunta katsoi hankkeen edistävän asemakaavan tavoitteita ja olevan toteutettavissa tietyin ehdoin.

Päätös Poikkeamishakemus hyväksyttiin tietyin ehdoin.

#### §126: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Björn Månssonin toivomusponnesta koskien puiden säilyttämistä ja pientaloasutuksen huomioon ottamista Kuusmiehentien ja Tuohuskujan asemakaavan muutoksen alueella

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta antoi lausunnon valtuutetun toivomusponnesta, jossa edellytettiin selvittämään mahdollisuutta säilyttää mahdollisimman suuri osa alueen puista ja ottaa huomioon ympäröivä pientaloasutus Kuusmiehentien ja Tuohuskujan asemakaavan muutoksen alueella Tuomarinkylässä. Lausunnossa todettiin, että asemakaavan muutoksen tarkoituksena on tehostaa maankäyttöä joukkoliikenteen runkolinjan varrella, mikä muuttaa pientaloaluetta matalien kerrostalojen alueeksi. Tämä vähentää puiden määrää tonteilla, eikä laajamittainen puiden säilyminen ole todennäköistä. Asemakaavassa on kuitenkin määrätty istutettavia alueita, ja rakennuslupavaiheessa ohjataan viherkertoimen avulla istutuksia. Uusia rakennuksia on pyritty sovittamaan pientaloympäristöön maltillisilla kerrosluvuilla ja materiaaleilla.

#### §127: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan vastaus kuntalaisaloitteeseen koskien Laajasalon Tahvonlahden asemakaavassa Stansvikintien muuttamista pihakaduksi ja Stansvikinpolun poistamista

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta vastasi kuntalaisaloitteeseen, jossa esitettiin Laajasalon Tahvonlahden asemakaavan muuttamista siten, että Stansvikintie muutettaisiin pihakaduksi ja Stansvikinpolku poistettaisiin. Aloitteen perusteluina olivat alueen kulttuurihistorialliset arvot ja huoli Stansvikinpolun tarpeettomuudesta ja luontoa tuhoavasta vaikutuksesta. Lautakunnan vastauksessa todettiin, että voimassa oleva asemakaava ja hyväksytty puistosuunnitelma ovat riittävän ohjaavia ja ajantasaisia alueen arvojen turvaamiseksi. Puistosuunnitelman mukaiset Stansvikinpolun rakennustyöt ovat jo alkaneet. Asemakaavan muutokselle ei katsottu olevan tarvetta.

#### §128: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Atte Harjanteen toivomusponnesta koskien mahdollisuutta varmistaa sujuva kävely-yhteys kampusalueelta Kustaa Vaasan tien bussipysäkille koko rakentamisvaiheen ajan

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta antoi lausunnon valtuutetun toivomusponnesta, jossa edellytettiin selvittämään sujuvan kävely-yhteyden varmistamista Kumpulanmäen kampusalueelta Kustaa Vaasan tien bussipysäkille rakentamisvaiheen aikana. Lausunnossa todettiin, että katusuunnittelu ja rakentamisen aikaisten liikennejärjestelyiden suunnittelu ovat vasta alkamassa. Suunnittelussa tullaan asettamaan lähtökohdaksi suorat ja sujuvat kävely-yhteydet joukkoliikenteen pysäkeille. Rakentamisen hallinnassa ja vaiheistuksessa tullaan huomioimaan kulkuyhteydet, ja urakoitsijaa voidaan velvoittaa varmistamaan reittien käytettävyys koko rakentamisen ajan, mahdollisesti tilapäisillä ratkaisuilla.

#### §129: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Otto Meren ym. valtuustoaloitteesta koskien kalsiumkloridin käytöstä luopumista kaupungin talvikunnossapidossa

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta käsitteli valtuustoaloitetta, jossa esitettiin kalsiumkloridin käytön kieltämistä kaupungin talvikunnossapidossa sen lemmikeille aiheuttamien haittojen vuoksi. Aloitteen jatkovalmistelussa oli selvitetty kalsiumkloridin käyttöä Helsingissä ja muissa kaupungeissa sekä sen vaikutuksia. Selvityksen mukaan kalsiumkloridi on tärkeä aine tehostettujen pyöräteiden liukkaudentorjunnassa ja keväisessä katupölynsidonnassa. Vaikka se voi ärsyttää koirien tassuja kylmällä säällä, vakavia haittoja ei ole raportoitu laajasti, eivätkä sen vaikutukset ole merkittävästi suurempia kuin muiden suolojen. Kunnossapito aikoo tarkistaa ohjeistuksia ja testata vaihtoehtoisia materiaaleja koirien oireiden vähentämiseksi, erityisesti pakkasella.

Vote Asia pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti Otto Meren ehdotuksesta.

#### §130: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan vastaus kuntalaisaloitteeseen koskien Kallion Hakaniemenrannan asemakaavan muuttamista korttelin 11207 osalta

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta vastasi kuntalaisaloitteeseen, jossa toivottiin Kallion Hakaniemenrannan asemakaavan muuttamista siten, että kortteli 11207 jätettäisiin rakentamatta ja muutettaisiin viheralueeksi, tai rakentamista lykättäisiin. Aloitteessa perusteltiin tarvetta viheralueiden lisäämisellä ja asuntomarkkinatilanteella. Vastauksessa todettiin, että voimassa oleva asemakaava mahdollistaa alueen täydennysrakentamisen ja vahvistaa Hakaniemen roolia osana keskustaa yleiskaavan mukaisesti. Kaavaan sisältyy uusia puistoalueita rantaan. Korttelin rakentaminen on osa laajempaa kokonaisuutta, ja sen muuttaminen pysyvästi tai väliaikaisesti viheralueeksi ei ole tarkoituksenmukaista kaupungin tavoitteiden kannalta.

#### §131: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan vastaus valtuutettu Aino Tuomisen ym. valtuustoaloitteeseen koskien meriakvaarion tai insectariumin rakentamista Eteläsatamaan

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta vastasi valtuustoaloitteeseen, jossa ehdotettiin maailmanluokan meriakvaarion tai insectariumin rakentamista Eteläsatamaan. Aloitteen mukaan tällainen kohde lisäisi Helsingin vetovoimaa, tarjoaisi mahdollisuuden uhanalaisten lajien suojeluun ja jakaisi tietoa meriekosysteemeistä tai hyönteisistä. Vastauksessa todettiin, että Eteläsatamaa kehitetään kaupungin strategian mukaisesti elämykselliseksi keskukseksi, jossa kulttuuri ja vapaa-aika ovat vahvasti läsnä. Makasiinirannan asemakaavoitus mahdollistaa näyttelytilojen sijoittumisen alueelle, ja valtuustoaloitteessa esitetty hanke olisi asemakaavan mukainen ja toteutettavissa alueen kehittämisvarauksen saaneen toimijan toimesta.

#### §132: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan vastaus valtuutettu Laura Kolehmaisen ym. valtuustoaloitteeseen, joka koskee elinkaarilaskennan kehittämistä ja/tai teettämistä puolueettomalla taholla

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta käsitteli valtuustoaloitetta, jossa esitettiin yhtenäisen ohjeistuksen laatimista rakennusten elinkaarilaskentaan ja selvittämistä, pitäisikö laskelmat teettää riippumattomalla taholla intressiristiriitojen välttämiseksi. Aloitteessa tuotiin esiin huoli siitä, että hankkeeseen ryhtyvä taho tuottaa laskelmat, jotka voivat vaikuttaa purku- tai korjauspäätöksiin. Vastauksessa todettiin, että Helsinki on ottanut käyttöön rakennuksen elinkaaren hiilijalanjäljen raja-arvon ja menetelmän asemakaavojen arviointiin. Ympäristöministeriö valmistelee uutta rakentamislain asetusta. Kaupunki tunnistaa tarpeen lisäohjeistukselle laskelmissa huomioitavista asioista ja raportin sisällöstä, ja asiantuntemusta laskelmien tarkastamiseksi vahvistetaan.

Vote Asia pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti Mia Haglundin ehdotuksesta.

# Helsinki City Board Meeting Minutes from 10.03.2025

#### § 149: Opinion to the Ministry of Social Affairs and Health on the temporary amendment of the Health Insurance Act (Kela reimbursement freedom of choice experiment)

The City Board provided an opinion on the proposed temporary amendment to the Health Insurance Act concerning a freedom of choice experiment for Kela reimbursements, primarily targeting individuals aged 65 and over. Helsinki does not support the proposal, citing concerns about significant increases in public spending (estimated at €27.6 million in 2025 and €82.9 million annually in 2026-2027) which the city believes would be better used to strengthen public healthcare. If the proposal is enacted, Helsinki stresses the importance of it being temporary and subject to careful evaluation regarding its effectiveness, impact on public healthcare demand, service availability, continuity, and potential migration of healthcare professionals to the private sector. The city supports targeting the over-65 age group, annual visit limits, and price caps, but notes risks related to professional migration and fragmentation of healthcare data, which could hinder the city's ability to coordinate services.

Vote: The City Board approved Titta Hiltunen's counter-proposal (against the experiment) over the original proposal.
Vote Outcome: Hiltunen's counter-proposal approved 8-7.

#### § 150: Opinion to the Ministry of Justice on the amendment of Chapter 16 of the Criminal Code (blue light sabotage)

The City Board considered providing an opinion on a government proposal to amend Chapter 16 of the Criminal Code to include new provisions regarding "blue light sabotage," which criminalizes obstructing police or emergency services through violence, threats, or damaging/stealing vehicles or equipment. The proposal aims to protect the operations and personnel of police, rescue services, and first aid. The proposed amendments include defining the offense and setting potential penalties.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 151: V 26.3.2025, Determining the rental principles for residential plots whose ground lease agreements expire in 2025

The City Board considered determining the rental principles for approximately 250 residential plots in various city districts whose ground lease agreements are set to expire in 2025. The proposal outlines principles for setting annual rents based on floor area and unit prices per district and plot type, with a transition period where the new rent is phased in over ten years. The proposal also addresses feedback received from residents and includes socio-economic impact assessments. The aim is to update rents to reflect current market values while ensuring fairness and considering the city's role as a landowner for all residents.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 152: V 26.3.2025, Zoning plan amendment no. 12787 for the blocks of Herttoniemi metro station (incl. traffic plan)

The City Board proposed to the City Council the approval of the zoning plan amendment for the area around Herttoniemi metro station. The plan facilitates the renovation and expansion of the metro station and public transport terminal, along with the construction of new residential and commercial buildings. It aims to transform the area into a more urban and vibrant hub, improving public spaces and transport connections. The amendment allows for significant new construction, including residential, commercial, office, and terminal facilities, and includes a traffic plan to improve pedestrian and cycling routes.

#### § 153: V 26.3.2025, Viikki-Malmi light rail general plan

The City Board considered the general plan for the Viikki-Malmi light rail line. The plan outlines the proposed route from Kumpula through Viikki and Malminkenttä to Malmi Hospital, with a potential future extension to Jakomäki and Vantaa. The project is primarily justified by urban development goals, aiming to support significant population growth in Northeast Helsinki by providing a high-capacity public transport link. The plan includes technical details, impact assessments (traffic, economic, environmental), and proposes a phased implementation, starting with the section to Malmi Hospital. The estimated cost for the first phase infrastructure is around €340 million.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter for two weeks.

#### § 154: V 26.3.2025, Zoning plan and zoning plan amendment for the western part of the Central Pasila tower area (no. 12613) (includes traffic plan)

The City Board proposed to the City Council the approval of the zoning plan and amendment for the western part of the Central Pasila tower area. The plan enables the construction of four distinct high-rise buildings, including residential and office spaces, located south of Pasilansilta bridge. It aims to create a high-quality, green urban environment with a public square and improved pedestrian connections, contributing to Pasila's development as a central area. The plan allows for a substantial increase in floor area for residential, commercial, and office use, adding approximately 1,100 residents and 2,200 jobs.

#### § 155: V 26.3.2025, Zoning plan amendment for the Länsi-Pakila small house area (no. 12916)

The City Board proposed to the City Council the approval of the zoning plan amendment for several plots in the Länsi-Pakila small house area. The amendment covers 27 plots and a park area, allowing for increased building efficiency on these properties, primarily raising the floor area ratio to 0.4 (and 0.5 on one plot). The goal is to enable moderate intensification of the area, allowing for expansion or new construction on existing plots, while preserving the area's characteristic layered building history and green, garden-like nature.

#### § 156: V 26.3.2025, Green Council Group's group initiative on securing jobs and cultural experiences in the cultural sector

The City Board considered the Green Council Group's initiative proposing that the city counteract state-level cuts to the cultural sector by increasing cultural grants and enhancing support services, cultural spaces, and event venues. The initiative highlights the impact of state cuts on Helsinki's cultural field and the importance of culture for employment and citizen well-being. The city's response details recent increases in cultural grant allocations in the 2024 and 2025 budgets and outlines other measures to support the cultural ecosystem, including providing subsidized spaces and developing strategies for the creative industries.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 157: Implementation of participatory budgeting 2025–2026

The City Board approved the principles for implementing the fourth round of Helsinki's participatory budgeting process, known as OmaStadi, for the years 2025-2026. The process allows residents to propose and vote on projects to be funded by the city. Based on feedback from previous rounds, the process will largely remain the same, emphasizing resource efficiency, clarity for residents, and the use of digital tools. The City Board decided to increase the total budget allocation for this round to 10 million euros, up from the previously proposed €8.8 million, to account for population growth and inflation. The funds will be allocated to major districts based on population.

Vote: The City Board unanimously approved the proposal to increase the budget allocation to 10 million euros.

#### § 158: Investment in the unrestricted equity fund of Helsingin kaupungin asunnot Oy and Helsingin Asumisoikeus Oy

The City Board approved an investment totaling 2 million euros into the unrestricted equity funds of the city's housing companies, Helsingin kaupungin asunnot Oy (Heka) and Helsingin asumisoikeus Oy (Haso). Specifically, €1,790,000 will be directed to Heka and €210,000 to Haso. This capital injection from the city's 2025 budget is intended to help mitigate the pressure for rent and user fee increases in the coming years, which has been influenced by rising interest rates and inflation. The investment is framed as compensation for the companies' public service obligations related to providing affordable housing.

#### § 159: Delegation of authority for the implementation of employment authority tasks

The City Board delegated specific authorities related to employment services and related legislation to the Employment Services Municipal Enterprise and its officials. This includes decision-making power for the enterprise's board regarding procurements and agreements, and for the CEO regarding legal representation in appeals and significant legality supervision matters, organization of multidisciplinary support, and agreements on vocational training. Various officials within the enterprise are delegated authority for handling jobseeker service processes, job placement, information services, expert assessments, vocational guidance, training, support payments, and integration services. This decision updates and replaces a previous delegation.

#### § 160: Real estate arrangement with Keskinäinen Työeläkevakuutusyhtiö Elo (Ilmala plot 17055/1, Roihuvuori plots 43203/9, 10 and 11 and Koskela plots 26960/1 and 2)

The City Board approved a complex real estate arrangement with the pension insurance company Elo. The core of the arrangement is for the city to acquire the Ilmala Hall plot (17055/1) from Elo, which is currently subject to an unusual sub-lease structure. To facilitate this, the city will reserve plots 26960/2 and 26960/1 in Koskela for Elo and its partners for residential development (rental and owner-occupied). The arrangement also involves the city selling plots in Roihuvuori (43203/9, 10, 11) and a share of plot 26960/2 in Koskela to Elo. The transaction will be executed as three simultaneous property sales by the end of 2025. The goal is to simplify the ownership structure of the Ilmala Hall plot and give the city more control over its future use, supporting the city's economic policy goals related to the event arena.

#### § 161: Opinion to the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Employment on the working group's report concerning the government proposal to amend the Public Procurement Act, the Act on Public Procurement in Special Sectors, and Section 6 b of the Criminal Records Act

The City Board provided its opinion on proposed amendments to national procurement legislation. Helsinki strongly opposes the introduction of a 10% minimum ownership requirement for contracting entities in related units (sidosyksiköt), arguing it infringes upon municipal self-governance and is not mandated by EU law. The city supports proposals to explicitly include ecological, social, and economic sustainability, as well as security and supply chain reliability, as objectives in procurement law. However, Helsinki opposes making decisions not to divide procurements appealable and mandating re-tendering if only one bid is received in an open procedure. The city also objects to mandatory post-award notices for national procurements and expanding the Competition and Consumer Authority's powers regarding national construction contracts.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 162: Councillor Amanda Pasanen's initiative on refraining from claiming damages in cases of non-violent civil disobedience

The City Board considered an initiative from Councillor Amanda Pasanen and others proposing that the city consider refraining from claiming damages in cases of non-violent civil disobedience during demonstrations, particularly when no significant property damage or equivalent harm occurs. The city's response outlines the principles of administrative law that guide its actions, including equality, purpose-bound authority, impartiality, and protection of legitimate expectations. It emphasizes that the constitution protects peaceful assembly, but not unlawful actions. The city argues that refraining from claiming damages for harm caused by illegal acts, regardless of the motive, would violate the principles of equality and impartiality, as it would treat offenders differently based on the nature of the offense. Therefore, the city maintains it has grounds to claim damages for harm caused by criminal acts resulting from demonstrations.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 163: Councillor Laura Kolehmainen's initiative on refraining from claiming damages in connection with citizens' nature activism

The City Board considered an initiative from Councillor Laura Kolehmainen and others proposing that the city refrain from claiming damages in cases of non-violent civil disobedience related to nature activism. The city's response reiterates the principles of administrative law (equality, purpose-bound authority, impartiality, protection of legitimate expectations) that govern its actions. It states that while freedom of expression and assembly are protected, unlawful actions, even those motivated by environmental concerns, do not receive constitutional protection. The city argues that claiming damages for harm caused by criminal acts is based on damage compensation law, not criminal law, and is necessary to restore the situation before the damage occurred. Refraining from claiming damages based on the motive of the act would violate the principles of equality and impartiality. Therefore, the city maintains it has grounds to claim damages for harm caused by criminal acts resulting from nature activism.

The City Board decided to postpone the matter.

#### § 164: Responding to initiatives submitted at the City Council meeting on 26.2.2025

The City Board decided how to process and respond to the 13 initiatives submitted during the City Council meeting on 26.2.2025. Seven initiatives, including a group initiative from the Swedish People's Party and individual initiatives from several councillors concerning topics like Swedish-language integration, kindergarten size, air quality, Independence Day celebrations, NIPT testing, and cultural/non-profit space rentals, will be responded to by the City Board and presented to the City Council. One initiative regarding free summer public transport for youth will be responded to by the City Board. The remaining five initiatives, concerning education space planning and pedestrian/cycling connections, are directed to the relevant sectoral committees (Education and Training Committee, Urban Environment Committee, Social, Health and Rescue Committee) for response.

# Helsinki Kaupunginhallitus Pöytäkirja 10.03.2025

#### § 149: Lausunto sosiaali- ja terveysministeriölle sairausvakuutuslain väliaikaisesta muuttamisesta (Kela-korvausten valinnanvapauskokeilu)

Helsinki ei kannata esitystä sairausvakuutuslain väliaikaisesta muuttamisesta ja Kela-korvausten valinnanvapauskokeilusta. Kaupunki katsoo esitettyjen muutosten lisäävän julkisia menoja merkittävästi ja näkee varojen käytön julkisen terveydenhuollon vahvistamiseen kannatettavampana. Lausunnossa tuodaan esiin riskejä, kuten ammattilaisten siirtyminen yksityiselle sektorille ja tietopohjan pirstaloituminen, mikä vaikeuttaa julkisen terveydenhuollon kokonaisvaltaista järjestämisvastuuta. Mikäli kokeilu toteutuu, sen tulee olla määräaikainen ja sen toimivuutta on arvioitava huolellisesti. Kokeilun kohdentaminen yli 65-vuotiaisiin ja käyntimäärärajaus sekä hintakatto nähdään perusteltuina. Kaupunginhallitus hyväksyi lausunnon, joka sisälsi Titta Hiltusen vastaehdotuksen mukaisen lisäyksen vastustuksesta ja sen perusteluista.

Vote Titta Hiltusen vastaehdotuksen mukaisesti muutettu ehdotus 8/7

#### § 150: Lausunto oikeusministeriölle rikoslain 16 luvun muuttamisesta (sinivilkkusabotaasi)

# Helsinki City Environment Committee Meeting Minutes from 08.04.2025

#### §200: Helsinki Street Green Network - Study

The City Environment Committee noted the study on Helsinki's street green network. The study maps the current state of street greenery, identifies areas needing improvement, and proposes actions to increase and diversify vegetation in street environments. It highlights the importance of street greenery, especially in densely built areas, for mitigating heat and stormwater vulnerability. The committee encouraged setting clear, measurable targets for increasing street greenness in the next phase of the work, particularly in identified deficit areas, and promoting a holistic approach. They also recommended reviewing underground infrastructure planning to facilitate the growth of large trees and re-evaluating historical areas for street greenness to address climate vulnerabilities.

Vote: Unanimously approved the proposal as amended by the counter-proposal.

#### §201: Ahdinranta, Valtamerilaituri, Street Plans, West Harbour, Jätkäsaari

The City Environment Committee approved the street plans for Ahdinranta and Valtamerilaituri, along with the longitudinal section plan for the Valtamerilaituri and Ahdinranta seawall, located in the West Harbour area of Jätkäsaari. These new streets are situated on the edges of the former harbour basin and will create a waterfront promenade integrated into the city center's recreational network. The plans aim to provide high-quality outdoor spaces for leisure by the sea and enable the construction of adjacent commercial buildings, a swimming beach, an outdoor exercise area, and a service building. The designs are consistent with existing city plans and traffic principles for the area. The estimated construction cost for the streets is 8.27 million euros.

#### §202: Ahdinranta Swimming Beach Area and Valtamerilaituri Outdoor Exercise Area, Park Plans, West Harbour, Jätkäsaari

The City Environment Committee approved the park plans for the Ahdinranta swimming beach area and the Valtamerilaituri outdoor exercise area in Jätkäsaari. The Ahdinranta area will be a new park built on reclaimed land, featuring a sandy beach, walkways, a lawn, and plantings, including playful elements like "fossil play features" and a water channel. The Valtamerilaituri area will be a new park equipped with various outdoor exercise equipment. These plans are based on existing city plans and aim to create recreational spaces that support the city's goals for outdoor physical activity. The estimated construction cost for these park areas is 3.68 million euros.

#### §203: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding Councillor Atte Kaleva et al.'s Initiative on Using Carbon Footprint to Guide Low-Carbon Pre-Construction

The City Environment Committee provided a statement to the City Board concerning an initiative proposing the use of carbon footprint as a tool to guide low-carbon pre-construction and set ambitious limits. The committee stated that while carbon footprint limits are applied to residential building construction, they are not currently used for foundation or pre-construction work due to the unique nature of ground conditions and the lack of comprehensive international standards. However, the city is actively promoting low-carbon pre-construction through other methods, such as piloting alternative foundation strengthening techniques and phasing out lime-cement. The statement emphasizes ongoing research into carbon-negative methods and the importance of integrating geotechnical considerations and low-carbon approaches early in land use planning.

#### §204: Appeal Against the Decision of the Head of Legal Services Unit of the City Environment Sector on Compensation for Damages 27.2.2025 § 17 (Slipping)

The City Environment Committee rejected an appeal against a decision by the Head of Legal Services Unit concerning a claim for compensation related to a slipping accident on stairs. The appeal was filed by an insurance company seeking recourse from the city for damages paid. The committee's decision was based on the finding that the winter maintenance of the stairs, including snow removal and weather checks, was carried out appropriately according to the prevailing conditions and maintenance records. The committee noted that photos provided by the appellant were taken a year after the incident and did not accurately depict the conditions at the time of the slip. The city concluded it was not negligent and therefore not liable for compensation under the Damages Act.

#### §205: Pääskylänkatu, Street Plan, Sörnäinen

The City Environment Committee considered the street plan for Pääskylänkatu in Sörnäinen. The plan proposes improvements to cycling infrastructure and safety at the intersection with Hämeentie and Aleksis Kiven katu, including the introduction of one-way cycle paths and raised pedestrian crossings. It also involves the removal of 15 parking spaces. The estimated construction cost is 430,000 euros. Following deliberation, the committee decided to table the matter for one week for further consideration.

Vote: Unanimously decided to table the matter for one week.

#### §206: Välitalontie, Elontie, Heinämiehentie, Niittyluhdantie, Lähdepolku, Ripusuontie, Niittyluhdankuja, Street Plans, Länsi-Pakila

The City Environment Committee approved the street plans for several residential streets in Länsi-Pakila: Välitalontie, Elontie, Heinämiehentie, Lähdepolku, Ripusuontie, and Niittyluhdankuja. These streets are currently in poor condition with inadequate drainage. The plans involve rebuilding the streets, including renewing the water and sewage networks and increasing stormwater capacity. The designs feature slightly narrowed roadways, natural stone curbs, and grass landscaping. Speed bumps will be added on some streets to manage traffic speed, and new pedestrian walkways will be constructed to enhance safety and usability. The total estimated construction cost for these projects is approximately 6.49 million euros.

#### §207: Sale of Kluuvi Administrative Building and Lease of Plot, and City Environment Committee's Proposal to the City Board for Approval of Preliminary Real Estate Sale Agreement (Kluuvi, Plot 232/8)

The City Environment Committee made decisions regarding the Kluuvi administrative building and its plot (232/8). The committee approved the sale of the building at Pohjoisesplanadi 19 / Unioninkatu 28 to Norra Esplanaden 19 Ab for 4,614,500 euros. They also approved leasing the plot to the same company for commercial and office use for a maximum of 30 years, with an initial annual rent of 264,275 euros. Furthermore, the committee proposed to the City Board that the plot be sold to Norra Esplanaden 19 Ab for a minimum price of 5,285,500 euros, subject to a preliminary real estate sale agreement that grants the company the right to purchase the plot within seven years. The total estimated value of the building and plot is approximately 9.9 million euros. The transaction aims to revitalize the building and aligns with the city's strategy of divesting properties not needed for its services.

#### §208: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding Councillor Otso Kivekäs et al.'s Initiative on Planning the Future of Herttoniemi and Roihupelto

The City Environment Committee considered providing a statement to the City Board regarding an initiative proposing denser development, including residential use, in the Herttoniemi and Roihupelto business areas. The initiative aims to reduce pressure on developing nature areas in East Helsinki. The committee's draft statement acknowledges the proposal but points out that changing the land use from predominantly business/industrial requires amendments to the city plan and careful consideration of the impacts on existing businesses, particularly industrial and logistical operations. The matter was tabled for one week for further discussion.

Vote: Unanimously decided to table the matter for one week.

#### §209: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding Councillor Katri Penttinen et al.'s Initiative Concerning the Re-evaluation of the Koivusaari City Plan

The City Environment Committee considered providing a statement to the City Board regarding an initiative calling for a re-evaluation of the Koivusaari city plan. The initiative specifically requests exploring ways to reduce sea fillings, considering environmental impacts on residents' health and comfort from increased population, and resolving the discrepancy regarding the Länsiväylä highway. The committee's draft statement asserts that the current city plan is up-to-date and its implementation is contingent on a pending court decision regarding water permits. It argues that re-opening the city plan is not necessary, although minor amendments to specific sub-areas are possible if needed. The matter was tabled for one week.

Vote: Unanimously decided to table the matter for one week.

#### §210: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding Councillor Katri Penttinen's Motion Concerning the Amendment of the Vattuniemi Center City Plan in Lauttasaari (No. 12701), Including the Traffic Plan

The City Environment Committee provided a statement to the City Board regarding Councillor Katri Penttinen's motion. The motion requested that future planning for the Vattuniemi center city plan amendment investigate minimizing disruption from extensive demolition and construction work by creating specific traffic management plans for these phases. It also suggested that future large infill projects should include a plan for minimizing construction impacts and a temporary traffic management plan upon city plan approval. The committee's statement explained that while the city can consider phasing and impact minimization during city plan preparation, detailed temporary traffic arrangements are typically the responsibility of the construction contractor, guided by city regulations. The city's influence on private development projects is limited in this regard.

#### §211: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding City Councillor Otto Meri's Motion Concerning Improving the Operating Conditions for Shared Cars

The City Environment Committee considered providing a statement to the City Board regarding Councillor Otto Meri's motion. The motion requested investigating the possibility of more effectively monitoring the implementation of shared car arrangements specified in plot transfer conditions. The committee's draft statement acknowledged the importance of shared car systems but explained that monitoring these specific conditions is part of the broader, resource-constrained monitoring of thousands of lease agreements. Actively focusing resources on monitoring shared car conditions would necessitate diverting resources from other monitoring activities. The matter was tabled for one week.

Vote: Unanimously decided to table the matter for one week.

#### §212: City Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board Regarding Councillor Björn Månsson's Motion Concerning Taking into Account the Character of Detached House Areas in City Plan Amendments Similar to Plan No. 12825 for the Raidepolku and Simakuja Areas

The City Environment Committee provided a statement to the City Board regarding Councillor Björn Månsson's motion. The motion requested investigating how to consider the character of detached house areas in similar city plan amendments, referencing plan no. 12825 for the Raidepolku and Simakuja areas. When planning apartment buildings near detached house areas, the objective is to adapt the scale of new construction to the existing environment. # Helsinki Education Committee Meeting Minutes from 08.04.2025

#### §109: Announcements
The Education Committee decided to note the following announcements: a situation update on changes to learning support and a decision from the Regional State Administrative Agency concerning a private early childhood education service provider. These items were presented for informational purposes.

#### §110: Monitoring Decisions of Subordinate Authorities from 27.3. - 2.4.2025
The Education Committee decided not to take up for consideration the decisions made by various subordinate authorities and bodies within the Education Division during the period from March 27 to April 2, 2025. This is a standard oversight procedure where the committee reviews decisions made at lower levels but opts not to intervene in these specific cases. The list of decisions included various procurements, budget confirmations, and acceptance of donations.

#### §111: Education Committee's Proposal to the City Board on Transferring Certain ICT Functions of the Division
The Education Committee proposed to the City Board that the ICT functions of the Infrastructure Services unit within the Education Division be transferred to DigiHelsinki Oy starting September 1, 2025. This transfer aligns with the city's goal of centralizing digital basic services to DigiHelsinki Oy, an in-house company. The transfer is also a key corrective measure identified after a data breach affecting the Education Division. The scope of the transfer includes server maintenance, device procurement and logistics, workstation management, asset registry and ticketing, license management, cloud services, and information security for educational activities. While the transfer is estimated to increase annual operating costs by approximately 2.0 million euros from 2026 onwards, it will reduce the division's IT investments by about 10 million euros annually. The transfer is planned to ensure service continuity and will involve the transfer of relevant personnel and contracts according to business transfer principles.

#### §112: Education Committee's Decision on the Procurement of Food and Cleaning Services for Area 3 for the Period 28.7.2025 – 29.7.2029
The Education Committee decided to procure food and cleaning services for Area 3 facilities within the Education Division from Compass Group Finland Oy for the period from July 28, 2025, to July 29, 2029, with a potential two-year option period. Compass Group Finland Oy was selected as the service provider for all four groups (Groups 1-4) in the competitive tendering process. The estimated value of the procurement, including the option period, is approximately 47 million euros (excluding VAT). The procurement process was conducted as an open procedure exceeding EU thresholds and included a business transfer of personnel for groups 1-3. The evaluation criteria included price (90 points) and quality (10 points) for groups 1-3, while group 4 also incorporated student participation (taste testing, 20 points) and responsibility (10 points) alongside price (70 points). The Director of the Division is authorized to sign the contracts and decide on the option period.

#### §113: Education Committee's Statement on the Project Plan for the Renovation of Ressu Comprehensive School at Lapinlahdenkatu 10
The Education Committee provided a favorable statement to the City Environment Committee's Building and Public Areas Subcommittee regarding the project plan for the renovation of Ressu Comprehensive School. The committee emphasized the critical importance of completing the renovation within the agreed schedule to ensure the provision of statutory services. They also stressed the need for continued close collaboration with the user division (education) during planning and implementation, particularly focusing on acoustics, sound insulation, lighting, and ensuring surfaces are easy to clean, maintain, and repair. The committee added a requirement, approved unanimously, that the inclusion process for teachers and other staff must be improved, as their views and feedback were not sufficiently considered in the initial planning. The statement also highlighted the significance of cost monitoring and quality control throughout the project to ensure a healthy and safe learning environment and manage operating costs. The renovated facilities are planned for approximately 660 students and are expected to be ready by December 2029, with temporary facilities located at Arkadiankatu 24.

Vote on amendment: Amendment by Mari Holopainen to add a point about insufficient inclusion of teachers and staff in the planning process.
Vote jaa: 11
Vote ei: 2
The amendment was approved.

#### §114: Education Committee's Statement on the Project Plan for the Renovation of Eira Daycare Center at Ehrensvärdintie 14
The Education Committee provided a favorable statement to the City Environment Committee's Building and Public Areas Subcommittee regarding the project plan for the renovation of Eira Daycare Center. The committee stressed the importance of timely completion of the facilities according to the planned schedule to ensure the provision of statutory services. They also required continued collaboration with the user division during planning and implementation, with specific attention to acoustics, sound insulation, lighting, and designing spaces and surfaces that are easy to clean, maintain, and repair. The committee pointed out that inadequate previous maintenance has led to more extensive repairs and additional costs, which are now reflected in the Education Division's rent for the facility. The renovated daycare will serve the same number of children (71) and is expected to be ready by August 2028, with temporary facilities located at Eiranranta 1.

#### §115: Education Committee's Statement on the Project Plan for Daghemmet Alexia Renovation at Aleksanterinkatu 1
The Education Committee provided a favorable statement to the City Environment Committee's Building and Public Areas Subcommittee regarding the project plan for the renovation of Daghemmet Alexia (Swedish-language daycare). The committee emphasized the need for the facilities to be completed precisely according to the planned schedule to ensure the provision of statutory services. They also stressed the importance of continued collaboration with the user division during planning and implementation, with particular attention to acoustics, sound insulation, lighting, and designing spaces and surfaces that are easy to clean, maintain, and repair. Following the renovation, the building will be fully utilized for Swedish-language early childhood education after the Finnish-language daycare moves to a different location. The renovated facilities are planned for approximately 70 children and are expected to be ready by January 2029, with temporary facilities located at Maurinkatu 1a.

#### §116: Education Committee's Statement to the City Board on Laura Rissanen's Council Initiative to Abolish 8 am Starts in Upper Secondary Schools
The Education Committee provided a statement to the City Board regarding the council initiative proposing to abolish 8 am starts in upper secondary schools. The committee noted that the City Council had previously suggested this in 2018, and the committee's earlier statement recommended delaying starts to between 8:30 and 9:00, while allowing schools autonomy to decide after consulting students and parents. A subsequent survey in 2019 found that students and parents generally did not want later starts due to the impact on afternoon hobbies. Currently, most upper secondary schools in Helsinki start between 8:15 and 8:30. The committee recommended that schools continue to consult students and parents on start times and retain the freedom to decide, while the division monitors student well-being, including sleep, through regular surveys like the School Health Survey.

#### §117: Education Committee's Statement to the City Board on Johanna Laisaari's Council Initiative to Expand the Catering Committee's Activities
The Education Committee provided a statement to the City Board supporting the council initiative to expand the activities of catering committees (ravintolatoimikunta) to all schools and educational institutions in Helsinki. The purpose of these committees, which include students, staff, and food service personnel, is to discuss and develop school meals and the dining environment at each location. The goal is to increase student and student participation in the development of school meals, thereby increasing interest and participation in school lunch. The committee added an emphasis that animal welfare must also be considered in food choices, in addition to the existing focus on plant-based foods for health and environmental reasons, as guided by national recommendations. The responsibility for establishing these committees rests with the individual schools and institutions.

Vote on amendment: Amendment by Sami Säynevirta to add emphasis on animal welfare in food choices.
Vote jaa: 11
Vote ei: 2
The amendment was approved.

#### §118: Education Committee's Decision on Appointing a Substitute for the Head of the Education Division for 10.-11.4.2025
The Education Committee decided to appoint Tero Vuontisjärvi, the Director of Finance and Planning for the Education Division, as the substitute for the Head of the Education Division for the period of April 10-11, 2025. This appointment was necessary because all five individuals designated as primary substitutes according to the established substitution order were unavailable during this time due to a work trip by the division's management.

#### §119: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to reject the appeal filed by Insinöörien ammattiyhdistys r.y. concerning the decision made by the Head of Education at Stadin ammattiopisto on December 20, 2024, to appoint a temporary teacher for the well-being and work-life skills component. The committee found that the grounds presented in the appeal did not warrant changing the decision. The selected candidate, holding a Master of Dance Arts degree and pedagogical studies, was deemed formally qualified for the position, which required expertise in well-being and work-life skills, including physical education and health knowledge. The committee stated that the selection was based on an overall assessment of the candidates' education, work experience, and performance during interviews, and the employer has broad discretion in selecting the most suitable candidate from among the qualified applicants.

#### §120: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to reject the appeal filed by Nuorliberaalit - Ungliberalerna ry concerning the same appointment decision as in § 119, regarding a temporary teacher for the well-being and work-life skills component at Stadin ammattiopisto. The committee found that the grounds presented in the appeal did not provide cause to alter the decision. Similar to the previous appeal, the committee concluded that the selected candidate met the formal qualification requirements for the position and that the selection was made based on a comprehensive evaluation of the candidates' qualifications, experience, and interview performance, which falls within the employer's discretion.

#### §121: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to reject the appeal filed by an individual concerning the same appointment decision as in § 119 and § 120, regarding a temporary teacher for the well-being and work-life skills component at Stadin ammattiopisto. The committee found that the grounds presented in the appeal did not justify changing the decision. The committee reiterated that the selected candidate was formally qualified for the position. Furthermore, the committee noted that the appellant, based on their application, did not meet the required formal qualifications for the position, specifically lacking the necessary scope of studies in the subject area despite holding other degrees and pedagogical studies. The selection was deemed to be based on a proper overall assessment of qualified candidates.

#### §122: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to accept the appeal filed by Insinöörien ammattiyhdistys r.y. concerning a different appointment decision made by the Head of Education at Stadin ammattiopisto on December 19, 2024, regarding a temporary teacher for mathematical-natural sciences and digital environment skills. The committee annulled the original appointment decision and returned the matter for re-processing. The reason for accepting the appeal was that the job advertisement was not sufficiently clear in specifying the required qualifications and the subject areas to be taught, potentially causing confusion among applicants regarding the necessary eligibility. The committee rejected other grounds for the appeal, such as the request to prohibit or suspend the implementation of the decision, as these were deemed unfounded under the Local Government Act.

#### §123: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to accept the appeal filed by Nuorliberaalit - Ungliberalerna ry concerning the same appointment decision as in § 122, regarding a temporary teacher for mathematical-natural sciences and digital environment skills at Stadin ammattiopisto. The committee annulled the original appointment decision and returned the matter for re-processing. The committee's reasoning was consistent with the previous appeal (§ 122), finding that the job advertisement lacked sufficient clarity regarding the required qualifications and the specific subject areas, which could have misled applicants. Other grounds for the appeal were rejected.

#### §124: Appeal Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Teacher
The Education Committee decided to accept the appeal filed by an individual concerning the same appointment decision as in § 122 and § 123, regarding a temporary teacher for mathematical-natural sciences and digital environment skills at Stadin ammattiopisto. The committee annulled the original appointment decision and returned the matter for re-processing. The committee's decision was based on the finding that the job advertisement was not sufficiently clear regarding the required qualifications and the subject areas, potentially causing confusion for applicants. The appellant had argued they were qualified and more meritorious than the selected candidate, but the committee focused on the procedural flaw in the advertisement.

#### §125: Appeal Regarding a Compensation Claim for Damages
The Education Committee decided to reject the appeal filed by an individual concerning the Education Division Director's decision on January 27, 2025, to deny a claim for compensation for damage to their car. The damage occurred when two children threw stones at the car parked next to a daycare playground. The committee found that the appeal did not present any new grounds that would warrant changing the original decision. Based on the investigation, the committee concluded that the supervision provided by the daycare staff during outdoor play was adequate and in accordance with guidelines. The damage was considered sudden and not a result of negligence or error by a city employee. Therefore, the City of Helsinki's Education Division was not deemed liable for compensation under the Tort Liability Act.

#### §111: Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnan esitys kaupunginhallitukselle toimialan eräiden ICT-toimintojen luovuttamisesta
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta esitti kaupunginhallitukselle, että toimialan infrapalvelut-yksikön ICT-toiminnot luovutetaan DigiHelsinki Oy:lle 1.9.2025 alkaen liikkeenluovutuksen periaatteiden mukaisesti. Luovutettaviin toimintoihin kuuluvat opetuksen palvelimien ja palvelinympäristöjen ylläpito, päätelaitteiden hankinnat ja logistiikka, työasemien hallinta, laiterekisteri ja tikettipalvelu, lisenssien hallinta, pilvipalvelut sekä tietoturva. Luovutus on osa kaupungin digitaalisten peruspalveluiden keskittämistä ja korjaava toimenpide tietomurron yhteydessä havaittuihin puutteisiin. Siirron arvioidaan aiheuttavan kertaluonteisia lisäkustannuksia 7,5 miljoonaa euroa vuosina 2025–2029 ja pysyvää lisäkustannusta noin 2,0 miljoonaa euroa vuodesta 2026 alkaen, mutta samalla toimialan tietotekniikkainvestoinnit pienenevät.

#### §112: Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnan päätös alueen 3 ruoka- ja puhtauspalveluiden hankinnasta kasvatuksen ja koulutuksen toimialan kohteille ajalle 28.7.2025 – 29.7.2029
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta päätti hankkia alueen 3 ruoka- ja puhtauspalvelut ajalle 28.7.2025 – 29.7.2029 sekä mahdolliselle optiokaudelle (2 vuotta) palveluntuottaja Compass Group Finland Oy:ltä kaikissa neljässä ryhmässä. Hankinta perustui kokonaistaloudelliseen edullisuuteen, jossa painotettiin hintaa (90 pistettä) ja laatua (10 pistettä) ryhmissä 1-3. Ryhmässä 4 otettiin lisäksi huomioon lukiolaisten osallistaminen (20 pistettä) ja vastuullisuus (10 pistettä). Hankinnan ennakoitu arvo optiokausi mukaan lukien on noin 47 miljoonaa euroa (alv 0 %). Toimialajohtaja oikeutettiin allekirjoittamaan sopimukset ja päättämään optiokauden käyttöönotosta.

#### §113: Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnan lausunto Ressun peruskoulun perusparannuksen hankesuunnitelmasta osoitteessa Lapinlahdenkatu 10
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta antoi puoltavan lausunnon Ressun peruskoulun perusparannuksen hankesuunnitelmasta kaupunkiympäristölautakunnalle. Lautakunta edellytti erityistä huomiota tilojen valmistumisen aikatauluun ja korosti tilojen suunnittelussa äänieristystä, äänenvaimennusta, valaistusta sekä helppohoitoisuutta. Lausunnossa lisättiin, että opettajien osallistamisprosessissa ei ole riittävästi huomioitu henkilökunnan näkemyksiä ja kuulemista tilasuunnittelussa on tarpeen jatkaa. Hankkeen kustannusseurannan ja laadunvalvonnan tärkeyttä painotettiin terveellisen ja turvallisen oppimisympäristön sekä käyttökustannusten kannalta. Hankkeen investointikustannus alittaa valtuuston asettaman tavoitteellisen kustannusraamin.

Vote Mari Holopaisen vastaehdotus hyväksyttiin yksimielisesti.

Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta antoi puoltavan lausunnon päiväkoti Eiran perusparannuksen hankesuunnitelmasta kaupunkiympäristölautakunnalle. Lausunnossa kiinnitettiin huomiota tilojen suunnittelussa äänieristykseen, äänenvaimennukseen, valaistukseen sekä helppohoitoisuuteen. #### §115: Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnan lausunto Daghemmet Alexian hankesuunnitelmasta osoitteessa Aleksanterinkatu 1
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta antoi puoltavan lausunnon Daghemmet Alexian hankesuunnitelmasta kaupunkiympäristölautakunnalle. Hankkeen investointikustannus ylittää valtuuston asettaman tavoitteellisen kustannusraamin, osittain hankkeen pienen koon vuoksi.

Lautakunta suosittaa, että yläkoululaisten koulupäivän aloituksen myöhentämisen vaihtoehdoista kuullaan oppilaita ja huoltajia, ja koulut päättävät aloituksesta kuulemisen jälkeen.

Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta antoi lausunnon valtuustoaloitteesta, joka esittää ravintolatoimikuntien perustamista kaikkiin kouluihin ja oppilaitoksiin. Vote Sami Säynevirran vastaehdotus (lisäys eläinten hyvinvoinnistä) voitti esittelijän ehdotuksen äänin 11-2.

#### §118: Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnan päätös kasvatuksen ja koulutuksen toimialajohtajan sijaisen määräämisestä ajalle 10.-11.4.2025
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta päätti määrätä talous- ja suunnittelujohtaja Tero Vuontisjärven toimimaan kasvatuksen ja koulutuksen toimialajohtajan sijaisena 10.-11.4.2025. Valitulla henkilöllä katsottiin olevan tehtävään vaadittu muodollinen kelpoisuus ja monipuolinen työkokemus. Vaatimusta päätöksen täytäntöönpanon kieltämisestä ja keskeyttämisestä ei hyväksytty.

Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta hylkäsi hakijan tekemän oikaisuvaatimuksen Stadin ammattiopiston koulutuspäällikön 20.12.2024 tekemästä valintapäätöksestä tuntiopettajan määräaikaiseen tehtävään. Lautakunta katsoi, että oikaisuvaatimuksessa esitetyt perusteet eivät antaneet aihetta päätöksen muuttamiseen ja viittasi esittelijän perusteluihin. Valitulla henkilöllä katsottiin olevan tehtävään vaadittu muodollinen kelpoisuus ja monipuolinen työkokemus, kun taas oikaisuvaatimuksen tekijällä ei katsottu olevan vaadittua muodollista kelpoisuutta.

#### §122: Oikaisuvaatimus tuntiopettajan ottamisesta määräajaksi
Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta hyväksyi Insinöörien ammattiyhdistys r.y:n oikaisuvaatimuksen Stadin ammattiopiston koulutuspäällikön 19.12.2024 tekemästä valintapäätöksestä määräaikaiseen tuntiopettajan tehtävään matemaattis-luonnontieteellisen osaamisen alueella. Kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunta hylkäsi hakijan tekemän oikaisuvaatimuksen toimialajohtajan 27.1.2024 tekemästä päätöksestä, jolla oli hylätty vahingonkorvausvaatimus päiväkodin viereisellä parkkipaikalla tapahtuneesta autovauriosta. Lautakunta totesi, että oikaisuvaatimuksessa ei ollut esitetty sellaisia uusia perusteita, jotka antaisivat aihetta päätöksen muuttamiseen. Saadun selvityksen perusteella kaupungin ei katsottu olevan vahingonkorvauslain nojalla korvausvelvollinen, sillä päiväkodin työntekijöiden valvontavastuun katsottiin olleen asianmukaisesti järjestetty ja toteutunut, eikä vahinko johtunut työntekijän virheestä tai laiminlyönnistä.

# Helsinki City Board Meeting Minutes from 07.04.2025

#### §215: Initiative by Councillor Sandra Hagman regarding a service home for rainbow seniors in Helsinki

This agenda item concerned an initiative submitted by Councillor Sandra Hagman and 26 other councillors proposing that Helsinki establish a service home specifically for rainbow seniors, taking inspiration from a model in Stockholm and collaborating with the Sateenkaariseniorit ry association. The initiative highlighted past discrimination faced by rainbow seniors and their fear of seeking services, particularly long-term care. The city's initial assessment was that while services for rainbow seniors would continue to be developed, a separate service home was not considered expedient. However, the Social, Health, and Rescue Services Committee suggested exploring whether a communal living unit could specifically cater to this group. The City Board considered the initiative.

Vote: The City Board unanimously approved the proposal to present to the City Council that the initiative be considered completed, amended by a counter-proposal from Paavo Arhinmäki to remove the phrase stating that a separate service home is not expedient from the reasoning.

#### §216: Initiative by Councillor Juha Hakola regarding the establishment of a Mental Health Ombudsman position

This item addressed an initiative from Councillor Juha Hakola and 31 other councillors urging the City Board to immediately investigate establishing a Mental Health Ombudsman position. The initiative cited increasing mental health issues, long service queues, and difficulties in coordinating services. The city's position was that the existing comprehensive and tiered mental health service system, along with current oversight mechanisms including patient advocates, made a separate ombudsman position unnecessary. The city detailed its wide range of services, integrated care models, and efforts to improve access and support vulnerable groups.

Vote: The City Board unanimously approved the proposal to present to the City Council that the initiative be considered completed, amended by a counter-proposal from Marcus Rantala to add a statement emphasizing the need to increase the participation and influence of service users and their families in the development, implementation, and evaluation of mental health services.

#### §217: Zoning plan change for the Meilahti Manor area (no. 12796)

The City Board considered a proposal for a zoning plan change concerning the Meilahti Manor area. The plan aims to transform the area into a public meeting place as part of the Meilahti villa district, enhancing its role as an active recreational and cultural area. Key objectives include bringing protected historical buildings and the former museum building (or a new structure) back into use, creating a cohesive new complex that respects the cultural-historical environment. The plan increases commercial building rights and involves developing the manor park and coastal routes. The proposal aligns with the city's strategy and general plan, emphasizing the preservation of cultural, natural, and landscape values.

The City Board proposed to the City Council to approve the zoning plan change as presented in the plan drawing and explanation dated 11.2.2025, which will create new blocks 15646 and 15647.

#### §218: Project plan for the expansion and space changes of Helsinki Media High School (Moisiontie 3, Tapulikaupunki)

This item involved the project plan for expanding and modifying Helsinki Media High School to accommodate a projected increase in student numbers from 980 to 1200 by August 2027. The current facilities are insufficient. The plan proposes relocating the majority of the temporary "Pikku-Finlandia" pavilion from Töölönlahti to the school site and connecting it. Internal changes will be made to the existing building, including moving the cafeteria and kitchen to the new section to free up space for classrooms. The project scope is approximately 2,147 gross square meters, with a maximum construction cost of 13.2 million euros (November 2024 cost level). The project is scheduled for phased implementation between 2025 and 2027.

The City Board proposed to the City Council to approve the project plan for the expansion and space changes of Helsinki Media High School, specifying the scope and maximum cost.

#### §219: Supplementing the election committees for the municipal elections

The City Board addressed the need to update the composition of the election committees appointed for the 2025 municipal elections. Following the initial appointments made on 3.2.2025, changes and additions to the committees were required. According to the Election Act, election committees should, where possible, represent the voter groups that nominated candidates in the previous municipal elections. The City Board is responsible for appointing these committees and their substitute members.

The City Board decided to amend the composition of the election committees and name substitute members as listed in the provided attachments.

#### §220: Establishment of a Supervising Veterinarian position in the Urban Environment sector from 14.4.2025

This item concerned the proposal to establish a new permanent position for a Supervising Veterinarian within the Urban Environment sector's Environmental Services. The position is to be located in the animal welfare team of the food safety unit. The establishment of this position as a permanent post is necessary because it involves the exercise of public authority in supervision tasks related to animal welfare and animal diseases, including inspections and the use of administrative coercive measures. The new position is intended to ensure sufficient resources for these statutory duties. Funding for the position has been allocated in the sector's budget, and the state will reimburse the salary according to the Veterinary Care Act.

The City Board decided to establish the Supervising Veterinarian position in the Urban Environment sector, effective from 14.4.2025.

#### §221: General plan for the Pitäjänmäki cycling route ("baana")

The City Board considered and approved the general plan for the Pitäjänmäki cycling route, a main cycling connection intended to be implemented in phases. The route spans 5.5 kilometers from Pasila to the Espoo border, with approximately 4 kilometers requiring new planning or construction. The primary goal is to increase cycling by improving the existing route along the railway, which currently suffers from narrowness and conflicts between cyclists and pedestrians. The plan proposes a primarily two-way cycle path with a separate pedestrian path and includes the construction of new bridges in Pitäjänmäki, Valimo, and Huopalahti to improve separation and safety. The total estimated cost for the phased implementation is 7.7 million euros. The plan aligns with the city's strategic goals for sustainable growth, increased cycling mode share, and carbon neutrality.

The City Board approved the general plan for the Pitäjänmäki cycling route, including its phased implementation and the total cost estimate of 7.7 million euros.

#### §222: General guidelines for City of Helsinki grants and ethical partnership principles for organizational cooperation and grant activities

This item involved the approval of updated general guidelines for City of Helsinki grants and new ethical partnership principles for cooperation and grant activities with organizations. The existing grant guidelines from 2019 were updated for clarity and technical details. The new ethical principles aim to standardize the city's approach to partnering with civil society organizations, emphasizing mutual trust and shared goals. The updated grant guidelines clarify conditions, principles, and application procedures, including a shift to primarily online information dissemination. They also specify activities ineligible for funding, such as religious or political activities, cash distribution, or funding the city's own operations. Both documents were developed collaboratively with city departments and organizations.

The City Board approved the updated general guidelines for City of Helsinki grants and the ethical partnership principles for organizational cooperation and grant activities. These new guidelines and principles will come into effect on 15.6.2025, and the old general guidelines will be repealed from the same date.

#### §223: City Board's grant criteria for promoting well-being and health

The City Board reviewed and confirmed updated grant criteria specifically for promoting well-being and health. The previous criteria, approved in 2022, covered both well-being/health promotion and social/health/rescue services grants. Due to the financial separation of social, health, and rescue services, distinct criteria were needed. The updated criteria for well-being and health promotion grants are aligned with the city strategy and well-being plan, focusing on reducing health disparities, preventing exclusion, and promoting participation. The criteria provide clearer definitions for administrative costs, direct aid, and activities that are not eligible for funding. Additionally, the City Board decided to introduce a new "small grant" type, capped at 3,000 euros, with a lighter administrative process. This small grant will be piloted in 2025 using unallocated funds from the well-being and health promotion grant budget and will be available to both registered and unregistered groups.

The City Board confirmed the updated grant criteria for promoting well-being and health, repealed the old criteria, and decided to introduce the new small grant type, to be piloted in 2025 using unallocated funds.

#### §224: City Board's grant criteria for resident participation

This item concerned the confirmation of updated grant criteria for resident participation. The previous criteria dated back to 2015. The updated criteria provide clearer definitions for free activities and the conditions for awarding salary grants. Salary grants are now specified to require the position to involve coordinating resident space activities, regional development/cooperation, and organizing open activities, and are not intended for general administrative tasks of the association. The criteria also clarify that long-term rental of grant-supported space to external parties is not covered by the grant. The updated criteria continue to emphasize regional balance, cooperation between organizations and the city, public benefit, impact, and organizational self-sufficiency. Increased monitoring of grant usage is also planned.

Vote: The City Board confirmed the updated grant criteria for resident participation and repealed the old criteria. This decision was made unanimously after incorporating a counter-proposal by Tuomas Rantanen, supported by Matias Pajula, which amended the final sentence of point 4 to state that if there are multiple grant-supported resident spaces in an area with clearly overlapping activities and participants, the full salary grant can be divided between two resident space operators.

#### §225: Responding to initiatives submitted at the City Council meeting on 26.3.2025

This item involved the City Board's decision on which city body would be responsible for responding to the ten initiatives that were submitted during the City Council meeting held on 26.3.2025. According to the city's administrative rules, the City Board is responsible for distributing these initiatives to the appropriate bodies for response.

The City Board decided that seven of the initiatives would be responded to by the City Board itself (for processing by the City Council), one initiative would be responded to by the City Board, one by the Education and Training Committee, and one by the Urban Environment Committee. The specific initiatives assigned were listed in the decision.

# Helsingin Kaupunginhallituksen Pöytäkirja 07.04.2025

#### §215: V 16.4.2025, Valtuutettu Sandra Hagmanin aloite sateenkaariseniorien palvelutalosta Helsinkiin
Valtuustoaloitteessa ehdotettiin sateenkaariseniorien palvelutaloyksikön toteuttamista Helsinkiin Tukholman mallin mukaisesti ja yhteistyössä Sateenkaariseniorit ry:n kanssa. Kaupunginhallitus totesi, että sateenkaariseniorien palveluja kehitetään ja yhdenvertaisia palveluja toteutetaan jatkossa, mutta erillistä palvelutaloa ei pidetä tarkoituksenmukaisena. Sosiaali-, terveys- ja pelastuslautakunta kuitenkin toivoi, että kaupunki selvittäisi sateenkaariseniorien erityishuomioimista jossakin yhteisöllisen asumisen yksikössä. Helsinki tarjoaa jo vertaisryhmätoimintaa seniorikeskuksissa ja Seniori-info on sateenkaarisertifioitu. Kaupunki rahoittaa myös sateenkaarisukupolvet-hanketta. Vanhusneuvosto muistutti syrjinnän kiellosta. Kaupunginhallitus esitti kaupunginvaltuustolle, että aloite katsotaan loppuun käsitellyksi.

Vote Paavo Arhinmäen vastaehdotus poistaa lause perusteluista: 15 jaa, 0 ei.

#### §216: V 16.4.2025, Valtuutettu Juha Hakolan aloite mielenterveysasiamiehen toimen perustamisesta
Valtuustoaloitteessa esitettiin selvitystyön käynnistämistä mielenterveysasiamiehen toimen perustamiseksi Helsinkiin. Kaupunginhallitus katsoi, että Helsingin nykyinen mielenterveyspalvelujärjestelmä on laaja, porrastettu ja kattavasti valvottu kokonaisuus, minkä vuoksi erillisen mielenterveysasiamiehen tehtävää ei pidetä perusteltuna. Kaupunki tarjoaa monipuolisia ja integroituja sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon palveluja, joissa hyödynnetään monialaista hoidon suunnittelua. Potilaiden etuja ja oikeuksia valvovat aluehallintovirasto, THL ja STM sekä sosiaali- ja potilasasiavastaavat. Kaupunginhallitus esitti kaupunginvaltuustolle, että aloite katsotaan loppuun käsitellyksi. Esitykseen lisättiin maininta palvelujen käyttäjien ja omaisten osallisuuden lisäämisestä.

Vote Marcus Rantalan vastaehdotus lisätä kappale perusteluihin: 15 jaa, 0 ei.

#### §217: V 16.4.2025, Meilahden kartanon alueen asemakaavan muutos (nro 12796)
Kaupunginhallitus esitti kaupunginvaltuustolle Meilahden kartanon alueen asemakaavan muutoksen hyväksymistä. Kaavaratkaisun tavoitteena on kehittää aluetta osana Meilahden huvila-aluetta siten, että kartanon alue avautuu yleisölle viihtyisänä kohtaamispaikkana ja koko huvila-alue kehittyy aktiivisena virkistys- ja kulttuurialueena. Suunnitelmassa pyritään löytämään sopiva käyttö suojelluille rakennuksille ja integroimaan uusia rakennuksia kulttuurihistoriallisesti arvokkaaseen ympäristöön. Kaavaratkaisu mahdollistaa liikerakennusten kerrosalan kasvun 611 k-m²:llä. Kartanonpuistoa ja rantareittejä kehitetään. Kaavaratkaisu perustuu konseptikilpailun voittaneeseen ehdotukseen ja se on valmisteltu yhteistyössä kehittäjän kanssa.

Hankkeen tarve perustuu Medialukion opiskelijamäärän kasvuun noin 980:sta 1200:een elokuusta 2027 alkaen, jolloin nykyiset tilat eivät ole riittävät. Hankkeessa koulua laajennetaan siirtämällä pääosa Töölönlahden väistötilapaviljongista ("Pikku-Finlandia") Medialukion tontille ja tekemällä siihen tilamuutoksia. Hankkeen laajuus on noin 2 147 brm² ja rakentamiskustannusten enimmäishinta on 13 200 000 euroa marraskuun 2024 kustannustasossa. Hankkeen arvioitu valmistuminen on elokuussa 2027.
