# Helsingin Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan Pöytäkirja 25.03.2025

#### §160: Konseptikilpailun järjestäminen Haltialan kotieläintilan kehittämiseksi ja rakennusten myymiseksi (Tuomarinkylä)

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta käsitteli esitystä konseptikilpailun järjestämisestä Haltialan kotieläintilan kehittämiseksi ja alueen rakennusten sekä eläinten myymiseksi. Kilpailun tavoitteena on löytää uusi omistaja ja kehittäjä, joka muuttaisi tilan aktiiviseksi ja houkuttelevaksi virkistys-, vierailu- ja matkailualueeksi. Kilpailu on suunnattu maatalous- ja matkailualan yrittäjille, joilla on kokemusta kotieläintilan hoidosta. Suunnittelualue koostuu kolmesta vuokra-alueesta Tuomarinkylässä, ja myytävät rakennukset sijaitsevat näillä alueilla. Päätös asiasta siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §161: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle Mai Kivelän ym. valtuustoaloitteesta koskien Haltialan kotieläintilan muuttamista eläinsuojelukeskukseksi

Lautakunta käsitteli lausuntoa valtuustoaloitteesta, jossa ehdotetaan Haltialan kotieläintilan muuttamista eläinsuojelukeskukseksi. Lausunto toteaa, että Haltialan alueen kehittämiseksi valmisteltava konseptikilpailu edellyttää kotieläintoiminnan jatkamista ja eläinten hyvinvoinnin varmistamista. Vaikka eläinsuojelukeskuksen perustaminen ei ole suora vaatimus kilpailussa, sitä ei myöskään poissuljeta, jos se on toteutettavissa muiden kilpailuehtojen puitteissa. Päätös lausunnon antamisesta siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §162: Teemaleikkiverkoston laatiminen ja suunnitteluperiaatteet

Esityksessä ehdotettiin teemaleikkiverkoston kehittämistä Helsinkiin ja ohjeellisten suunnitteluperiaatteiden hyväksymistä teemallisille leikkikohteille. Verkoston tavoitteena on edistää uusien, vetovoimaisten ja elämyksellisten leikkipuistojen ja -paikkojen toteutumista eri puolille kaupunkia seuraavan 15 vuoden aikana. Verkosto jaetaan pääkohteisiin, merkittäviin kohteisiin ja tähtikohteisiin. Päätös asian hyväksymisestä siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §163: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan esitys kaupunginhallitukselle, Puotilan metroaseman alueen tarkistettu asemakaavan muutosehdotus (nro 12919) (sisältää liikennesuunnitelman)

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta esitti kaupunginhallitukselle Puotilan metroaseman alueen tarkistetun asemakaavan muutosehdotuksen hyväksymistä. Kaavaratkaisu mahdollistaa alueen kehittämisen metroon kytkeytyväksi, urbaaniksi asumisen ja palveluiden keskittymäksi, lisäten asukasmäärää noin 1100:lla. Alueelle suunnitellaan uusia asuin-, liike- ja toimistorakennuksia sekä julkisia aukioita. Liikennesuunnitelma parantaa kävely- ja pyöräily-yhteyksiä ja varautuu tulevaan raitiotiehen. Lautakunta lisäsi päätökseen kehotuksen panostaa viheralueiden visuaaliseen kiinnostavuuteen ja monipuolisuuteen.

Vote Hyväksyttiin Saana Rossin vastaehdotuksen mukaan yksimielisesti.

#### §164: Stoan ja Puhoksen alueen asemakaavan muutosehdotus (nro 12959) ja sen asettaminen nähtäville (sisältää liikennesuunnitelman)

Lautakunta käsitteli asemakaavan muutosehdotusta Stoan ja Puhoksen alueelle Itäkeskuksen ja Puotinharjun rajalle. Kaavaratkaisun tavoitteena on muuttaa alue nykyistä elinvoimaisemmaksi, monipuolisemmaksi ja kaupunkimaisemmaksi kulttuurin ja kaupan alueeksi, jossa myös asutaan. Suunnitelma sisältää kulttuurikeskus Stoan laajennuksen, uuden julkisen puiston, uusia asuntoja ja liiketiloja sekä Puhoksen osan purkamisen ja suojelun. Liikennesuunnitelma tarkistaa katutilan käyttöä eri liikkumismuodoille ja varautuu raitiotiehen. Päätös ehdotuksen nähtäville asettamisesta siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §165: Itäkeskuksen korttelin 45071 tonttien 1 ja 2 rakennuskiellon pidentäminen (nro 12975)

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta päätti pidentää Itäkeskuksen korttelin 45071 tontteja 1 ja 2 koskevaa rakennuskieltoa kahdella vuodella 11.5.2027 asti. Tontit sijaitsevat alueella, jolle on vireillä asemakaavan muutos, joka muuttaa käyttötarkoitusta ja lisää rakennusoikeutta. Rakennuskiellon pidentäminen on tarpeen alueen rakennetun ympäristön arvojen säilyttämiseksi ja kaavoituksen keskeneräisyyden vuoksi. Päätös tuli voimaan ennen lainvoimaisuutta.

#### §166: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle Ruotsalaisen kansanpuolueen valtuustoryhmän ryhmäaloitteesta, joka koskee olympiarakennusten liittämistä UNESCO:n maailmanperintölistalle

Lautakunta antoi lausunnon valtuustoaloitteesta, jossa esitetään Helsingin olympiarakennusten liittämistä UNESCO:n maailmanperintöluetteloon. Lausunto toteaa, että Helsingin olympiarakennukset muodostavat hyvin säilyneen kokonaisuuden, mutta Museoviraston arvion mukaan kaikkien rakennusten sarjanimeäminen maailmanperintölistalle ei ehkä ole realistista. Lautakunta katsoo, ettei esitystä ole tarkoituksenmukaista ryhtyä valmistelemaan, mutta pitää tärkeänä, että kaupunki pitää olympiarakennukset esillä keskusteluissa Museoviraston ja opetus- ja kulttuuriministeriön kanssa.

Vote Hyväksyttiin Silja Borgarsdottir Sandelinin vastaehdotuksen mukaan yksimielisesti.

#### §167: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Hilkka Ahteen ym. valtuustoaloitteesta koskien Patsaspuhuu.fi sivuston uudelleen avaamista

Lautakunta antoi lausunnon valtuustoaloitteesta, jossa esitetään Patsaspuhuu.fi-sivuston uudelleen avaamista ja siirtämistä Helsingin kaupungin taidemuseo HAM:lle. Sivusto suljettiin teknisten, tietoturva-, tietosuoja- ja tekijänoikeuskysymysten vuoksi. Lautakunta toteaa, että sivuston ylläpito ei kuulu kaupunkiympäristön toimialan tehtäviin ja ei näe estettä sen siirtämiselle HAM:lle. Uudelleen avaaminen edellyttää kuitenkin rahoituksen turvaamisen lisäksi erityisesti tekijänoikeuskysymysten ratkaisemista sekä tietosuojan ja -turvan parantamista.

#### §168: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Aino Tuomisen ym. valtuustoaloitteesta koskien Lauttasaaren Särkiniementien ja Tallbergin puistotien nimeämistä uudelleen ja liikennejärjestelyiden muuttamista

Lautakunta käsitteli lausuntoa valtuustoaloitteesta, jossa ehdotetaan Lauttasaaren Särkiniementien ja Tallbergin puistotien nimeämistä uudelleen kaduiksi sekä useita liikennejärjestelymuutoksia turvallisuuden ja viihtyisyyden parantamiseksi. Aloitteessa esitettiin mm. nopeusrajoitusten laskemista, suojateiden korottamista, ajoratojen kaventamista ja pyöräkaistojen lisäämistä. Lausunto toteaa, että nimenmuutos ei ole perusteltu ja liikenneympäristöön ehdotettuja laajoja muutoksia tulee tarkastella osana alueellista liikenne- ja kaupunkitilasuunnitelmaa. Päätös lausunnon antamisesta siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §169: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan vastaus valtuutettu Aino Tuomisen ym. valtuustoaloitteeseen koskien väärinpysäköinnin ja väkijoukkoon ajamisen estämistä keskustassa pollareita lisäämällä

Lautakunta käsitteli vastausta valtuustoaloitteeseen, jossa ehdotetaan pollareiden eli ajoestetolppien käytön merkittävää laajentamista keskustassa väärinpysäköinnin ja väkijoukkoon ajamisen estämiseksi. Vastaus toteaa, että ajoesteitä käytetään, kun niistä on enemmän hyötyä kuin haittaa, mutta niiden laajamittainen käyttö kadunsuuntaisesti on haastavaa kunnossapitovaatimusten ja tehokkuuden vuoksi. Törmäyksenkestäviä esteitä käytetään vain poikkeustapauksissa poliisin tai pelastusviranomaisten esityksestä. Päätös asian loppuun käsittelystä siirrettiin pöydälle.

Vote Pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti.

#### §170: Erottajankadun ja Uudenmaankadun risteyksen ympäristön liikennesuunnitelma

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta hyväksyi liikennesuunnitelman Erottajankadun ja Uudenmaankadun itäpään liikennejärjestelyjen suunnitteluperiaatteiksi. Suunnitelma vakinaistaa väliaikaiset järjestelyt, jotka ovat olleet käytössä osana Esplanadien kokeilua. Järjestelyt sisältävät Erottajankadun itälaidan jalkakäytävän leventämisen ja yhden ryhmityskaistan poistamisen Uudenmaankadulta. Järjestelyjen arvioidaan olevan käytössä arviolta 2030-luvun alkuun asti, jolloin alueelle on suunnitteilla vesihuoltosaneeraus.

#### §171: Alueen vuokraaminen Senaatti-kiinteistöiltä kaupungille yleiseen leikkipaikkakäyttöön (Kruununhaka, tontti 1012/12)

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta päätti hyväksyä Senaatti-kiinteistöiltä vuokratun puistoalueen uudelleen vuokrauksen Kruununhaassa yleiseen leikkipaikkakäyttöön. Alue on noin 820 m²:n suuruinen määräala tontista 1012/12 ja se on ollut kaupungin hallinnassa ja leikkipaikkakäytössä vuodesta 1978. Uusi käyttöoikeussopimus alkaa 1.8.2025, ja alueesta aletaan periä maanvuokraa 21 000 euroa vuodessa. Vuokraaminen katsottiin tarpeelliseksi kantakaupungin leikkipaikkaverkoston kannalta.

#### §172: Kahden tontin ja yhden alueen vuokraaminen Kiinteistö Oy Eliel Saarisen tie 41-45:lle (Haaga, tontit 29026/9 ja 10 sekä määräala tontista 29026/8)

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta päätti vuokrata Haagassa sijaitsevat tontit 29026/9 ja 10 sekä määräalan tontista 29026/8 Kiinteistö Oy Eliel Saarisen tie 41-45:lle opetustoimintaa varten 31.12.2054 saakka. Alue on varattu Englantilaisen koulun toteuttamissuunnittelua varten. Vuokra-alue on rakentamaton, ja sille on voimassa asuin-, liike- ja julkisten palvelutilojen sekä sosiaali- ja terveydenhoitoa palvelevien rakennusten asemakaava. Vuokra perustuu yleisten rakennusten tonttien hintatasoon ja toteutuneeseen rakennusoikeuteen, ja sen markkinaehtoisuus on varmistettu.

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta päätti vuokrata Malmilla sijaitsevan teollisuustont

# Helsinki Culture and Leisure Committee Meeting Minutes from 25.03.2025

#### §30: Monitoring Decisions of the Culture and Leisure Sector

The Culture and Leisure Committee decided not to take up for consideration several decisions made by subordinate officials within the sector. These decisions covered various areas including procurement proposals for sketches for school and daycare projects, acquisition of artworks for the city's art collection, rent reduction for a restaurant, research permits for library services, and confidential matters. Additionally, decisions related to sports facilities maintenance, rental of changing rooms and land areas, event partnership agreements, and youth services like research permits and the Hobby Finland model were included in the list not reviewed by the committee. The committee's decision aligns with the administrative rule allowing the committee or deputy mayor to take up decisions made by subordinate bodies or officials, but in this instance, they chose not to.

#### §31: Culture and Leisure Sector Activity Report 2024

The Culture and Leisure Committee approved the activity report for 2024, authorizing the sector director to make minor necessary changes. The report highlighted the achievement of the binding target to develop a service network planning model. The total number of physical and digital visits to the sector's services significantly exceeded the target of 23 million, reaching 25.5 million. The City Library achieved a record high of over 9.2 million physical visits, partly due to the new Kalasatama library. Sports services also saw high visitor numbers, exceeding their target despite some facilities being under renovation. The City Museum maintained its position as a popular museum, ranking second nationally. Cultural centers also attracted large audiences, with some venues setting new visitor records. Special focus was placed on children, youth, and the elderly, with youth services focusing on mental well-being and reducing loneliness, and sports services organizing activities for the elderly. Financially, the sector's income was higher than expected, and expenses were lower, resulting in an operating margin better than the final budget.

#### §32: Culture and Leisure Sector 2024 Financial Statement

The Culture and Leisure Committee approved the financial statement for the Culture and Leisure Sector for 2024. The operating margin for the sector's operating expenses (budget item 4 10 01) was -229.0 million euros, which was approximately 4.9 million euros better than the final budget of -233.9 million euros. Total income for the sector was 33.5 million euros, exceeding the target by 1 million euros, primarily due to better-than-expected sales from sports courses, outdoor swimming pools, facility rentals, and land leases. Income fell short in the City Museum shop (due to renovation) and Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra ticket sales. Government grants received were also lower than budgeted. Total expenses were 262.5 million euros, which was 3.9 million euros below the target, mainly due to savings in personnel costs (natural turnover, recruitment delays, leave conversions), rent, and service purchases. Investment spending on movable assets was 6.4 million euros against a final allocation of 7.4 million euros, with the underspending mainly in ICT investments.

#### §33: Appeal regarding library usage ban

The Culture and Leisure Committee rejected the appeal concerning a temporary usage ban at Helsinki Central Library Oodi. The appellant had been issued a ban from February 26, 2025, to March 28, 2025, for repeatedly disturbing library activities, specifically by filming a reading group against the organizer's and participants' explicit requests. The ban duration was initially miscalculated but corrected to comply with the maximum 30-day limit allowed by the Library Act. The committee noted that the appellant had caused disturbances on previous occasions and had been informed about the possibility of a ban. The committee reasoned that while filming is generally allowed in library spaces, it must not disturb library operations or customers' privacy, and the library has the right to intervene when it does. The immediate enforcement of the ban was deemed necessary to prevent further disturbance. The committee found no new information in the appeal that warranted changing the decision.

#### §35: Approval of the needs assessment for the replacement new building of Herttoniemi Sports Park maintenance building

The Culture and Leisure Committee approved the needs assessment for the replacement new building at Herttoniemi Sports Park. The committee emphasized that the views of staff and stakeholders should continue to be considered in the project's planning and implementation. The committee also requested that the design accommodate the needs of sports clubs to organize temporary kiosk sales during games or tournaments. Furthermore, the committee strongly highlighted that comprehensive plans for sports parks should be presented to the responsible committee for a statement before the Urban Environment Sector makes decisions on such projects, noting that the overall plan for Herttoniemi Sports Park had not been reviewed by the Culture and Leisure Committee. The current maintenance building, built in the 1970s, is in poor condition and will be replaced by a new, larger building (360 sqm vs 153.5 sqm) to serve the growing population in the area. The new building is estimated to be completed in August 2026, with temporary facilities needed during construction. The estimated annual rent for the new building will increase significantly compared to the current one.

Vote on Paavo Arhinmäki's counter-proposal (regarding committee review of sports projects) was unanimous.
Vote on Tuomas Tuomi-Nikula's counter-proposal (regarding kiosk sales) was unanimous.

#### §36: Culture and Leisure Committee's statement to the City Board on the council initiative by Councillor Mari Holopainen et al. regarding starting activities for youth in Kalasatama

The Culture and Leisure Committee provided a statement to the City Board regarding the initiative to start youth activities in Kalasatama. The committee considers the initiative important and will take it into account in its planning. The need for youth work in the growing Kalasatama area has been recognized, with a youth centre planned for 2028 and increased staff resources allocated to the Pasila youth work unit (which includes Kalasatama) in 2025. The committee acknowledges the need for continued work in the area and will explore possibilities to start activities for youth in 2026. The committee stressed the importance of providing youth activities and spaces as soon as possible and will investigate how activities can be initiated before the permanent facilities are ready, potentially utilizing spaces in the shopping center or other shared facilities in the area. Currently, youth in Kalasatama can access services in nearby areas like Arabianranta, Herttoniemi, Oodi, and special facilities like Narrin näyttämö and Tiivistämö, as well as outreach youth work.

Vote on Lukas Korpelainen's counter-proposal (regarding temporary spaces) was unanimous.

#### §37: Culture and Leisure Committee's statement to the City Board on the council initiative by Councillor Hilkka Ahde et al. regarding reopening the Patsaspuhuu.fi website under HAM Helsinki Art Museum

The Culture and Leisure Committee decided to table the item regarding the reopening of the Patsaspuhuu.fi website under HAM Helsinki Art Museum. The initiative proposed reopening the site, which featured "talking statues" and information about Finnish presidents, and transferring its responsibility from the Urban Environment Sector (which closed the site in 2024) to HAM. The committee's proposed statement had suggested not supporting the reopening, citing issues with ownership, copyright, data security, technical maintenance, and costs, and noting that HAM is a foundation and the city cannot decide on its behalf. The statement also pointed out that the more popular Suomenpresidentit.fi site could be considered a national interest. However, the committee unanimously decided to table the matter for further consideration.

Vote to table the item was unanimous.

#### §38: Culture and Leisure Committee's statement to the City Board on the council initiative by Arja Karhuvaara et al. "Volunteer seniors for afternoon homework help in libraries"

The Culture and Leisure Committee provided a statement to the City Board regarding the initiative to introduce volunteer seniors for afternoon homework help in libraries. The committee views organizing homework help and other joint activities in libraries as a positive leisure activity for children and youth. Libraries are accessible and safe spaces located near schools and residential areas, suitable for after-school hours. These intergenerational moments can create meaningful encounters. While seniors may not be able to help with all modern subjects, they can learn together with the children. The committee noted that volunteer-based homework help already exists in some Helsinki libraries, facilitated by organizations like the Red Cross and parishes. Expanding guided homework or hobby sessions in libraries is possible either through external organizations or through the Culture and Leisure Sector's coordinated volunteer work. Both options require finding new volunteers and assigning responsible coordinators within the sector.

# Helsinki City Board Meeting Minutes from 24.03.2025

#### §183: Opinion to the Ministry of Social Affairs and Health on amending the Act on the Organisation of Social and Health Care and certain other acts
The City Board considered providing an opinion to the Ministry of Social Affairs and Health regarding proposed amendments to social and health care legislation. The proposed changes included relaxing restrictions on subcontracting by private service providers, modifying the approval process for investment plans, and clarifying monitoring obligations for personnel resources. The draft opinion from the city supported increased flexibility in subcontracting but raised concerns about the administrative burden and monitoring challenges, particularly with subcontracting chains. It also opposed the proposed change allowing the Ministry to reject investment plans based on national targets, deeming the criteria insufficiently precise. Furthermore, the opinion criticized the proposed timeline and resource implications for personnel data collection and reporting, suggesting a later implementation date. Finally, the city opposed the proposed change requiring all social welfare law appeals to be handled by a multi-member body, arguing that the current system allowing official-level handling is effective and faster, while also better protecting sensitive client data.

Vote: The City Board decided unanimously to postpone the matter.

#### §184: Project Plan for the Replacement New Building of Puistola Primary School, Daycare, Playground, and Sports Hall (Koudantie 2, Puistola)
The City Board proposed to the City Council the approval of the project plan for a new building replacing the current Puistola primary school, daycare, playground, and sports hall. The existing facilities at Koudantie 2 and Nurkkatie 2 require extensive repairs and do not fully meet functional requirements, with the Koudantie building suffering from significant indoor air issues. The new building, located at Koudantie 2, is planned to accommodate 650 primary school students, 224 daycare children (including approximately 20 new spots), a playground, and a sports hall. The project aims to create a multi-functional public service building that supports integrated learning paths, staff cooperation, and versatile community use, including sports activities. The total area is approximately 12,154 gross square meters, with a maximum construction cost of 53,960,000 euros (excluding VAT) at the April 2024 cost level. The project is included in the city's 2025-2034 construction program, with building expected to start in April 2026 and finish in October 2028, with operations beginning in January 2029. Temporary facilities are arranged for the school, daycare, and sports hall during construction.

#### §185: Initiative by Councillor Minna Lindgren on Music Education in All Schools
The City Board proposed to the City Council that the initiative by Councillor Minna Lindgren and 27 other councillors regarding providing professional music education equally in all schools be considered processed. The initiative called for the city to explore various possibilities to achieve this goal. The City Board noted that music is taught in all schools according to the curriculum, ensuring quality regardless of the teacher or school. While class teachers are qualified to teach all subjects in primary school, some schools utilize subject teachers for music. The city offers professional development opportunities for teachers in music. The City Board accepted an amendment to the proposal, stating that the City Board notes that the strengthening of music and other arts and skills education will be investigated during the next council term.

Vote: The City Board decided unanimously to approve the proposal as amended.

#### §186: General Plan for the Viikki-Malmi Light Rail Line
The City Board considered the general plan for the Viikki-Malmi light rail line, a project aimed at improving public transport and supporting urban development in Northeast Helsinki, particularly the new Malminkenttä area. The plan outlines the route from Kumpula through Viikki and Malminkenttä, with potential extensions to Malmi Hospital and Jakomäki/Vantaa. The project is seen as crucial for accommodating the projected population growth in the area, as bus services are expected to become insufficient. The plan includes impact assessments, noting the project's significant urban development benefits and potential to increase land value and construction, although the socio-economic benefit-cost ratio is estimated to be low (0.24-0.34 depending on phasing and assumptions). The estimated infrastructure investment for the first phase (to Malmi Hospital) is around 340 million euros (excluding VAT), with a total cost of 440 million euros for both phases. The state is expected to contribute 30% to the planning phase. The project faces risks related to the pace of urban development, housing market conditions, and potential appeals.

Vote: The City Board decided unanimously to postpone the matter. Several counter-proposals were made but were not processed due to the postponement.

#### §187: General Plan for the Mariantunneli Tunnel
The City Board considered the general plan for the Mariantunneli tunnel, a pedestrian and bicycle tunnel connecting the Baana route in the railway cutting and the Lapinlahdentie area, passing under Mechelininkatu and the former Maria Hospital area. This tunnel is part of the larger Länsibaana network, intended to provide a high-quality cycling and walking route from the west to central Helsinki. The current route involves navigating a busy intersection with Mechelininkatu, which is inconvenient and less safe. The proposed tunnel, approximately 190 meters long, would separate pedestrian and bicycle traffic and provide a direct, smooth connection. It would also improve access between the Maria campus area and the Lapinlahti area. The project's total estimated cost is 18.5 million euros (excluding VAT). The plan aims to minimize impact on historical buildings and trees. The project is included in the city's 10-year investment program, with construction potentially starting in the next council term (2025-2029).

Vote: The City Board decided unanimously to postpone the matter.

#### §188: Monitoring Decisions of City Authorities
The City Board reviewed decisions made by various city authorities during week 12 (March 18, 2025). The purpose is to exercise the City Board's right to take up decisions for reconsideration if deemed necessary. The City Board decided to postpone the consideration of exercising this right specifically for the decisions made by the Urban Environment Committee on March 18, 2025. For decisions made by other authorities during the same week, the City Board decided not to exercise its right to take them up for reconsideration.

Vote: The City Board decided unanimously to postpone the consideration of the right to take up decisions made by the Urban Environment Committee on 18.3.2025.

#### §189: Approval of the City of Helsinki's 2024 Financial Statements
The City Board proposed to the City Council the approval of the City of Helsinki's 2024 financial statements, including those for "Kunta-Helsinki" (municipal Helsinki) and the social, health, and rescue services sector. The overall result for the City of Helsinki before changes in provisions and funds was a surplus of approximately 364.9 million euros. The result for "Kunta-Helsinki" was a surplus of approximately 336.0 million euros, which was better than budgeted but lower than the previous year due to exceptional tax revenues in 2023 related to the Sote reform. Operating expenses for "Kunta-Helsinki" grew faster than the target level, partly due to early childhood education legislation and vocational training costs. Investments for "Kunta-Helsinki" were 822.7 million euros, slightly less than in 2023. The cash flow from operations and investments was negative (-94.8 million euros). The financial statements also detail the city group's results, investments (including significant investments by Helen group and housing companies), and debt levels, noting an increase in consolidated debt and relative indebtedness. The report highlights risks to financial sustainability from the large investment program and potential future cuts in state funding.

#### §190: Defining Sales Principles for a Residential Apartment Building Plot (Laajasalo, Kruunuvuorenranta, plot 49291/2)
The City Board approved the sales principles for plot 49291/2 in the Kruunuvuorenranta area of Laajasalo, designated for unregulated market-rate ownership housing. The plot will be sold to Asunto Oy Helsingin Renata, a housing company established by Bonava Suomi Oy. The sales price is based on unit prices per floor square meter: 1,143 euros for residential space and 350 euros for commercial or similar space. The total purchase price is calculated based on the realized floor area, but not less than the floor area specified in the local detailed plan. The city reserves the right to charge an additional price per square meter if the realized floor area exceeds the planned amount. The decision to sell the plot, rather than lease it, is based on the plot being fully developed in terms of planning, its valuable location, and the price being determined at market value based on a previous quality and price competition and confirmed by independent appraisers.

#### §191: Opinion on Legislation Concerning the Development of the Jobseeker Service Process and Employment Services
The City Board provided an opinion to the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Employment on the draft government proposal concerning the development of the jobseeker service process and employment services. Helsinki supports streamlining services based on jobseeker needs but criticizes the proposed changes as too minor and potentially increasing rigidity in some areas. The city argues that the transfer of employment services to municipalities has been underfunded and that proposed cuts further exacerbate this. Helsinki advocates for greater flexibility for employment authorities to tailor services and prioritize resources towards those who need more support to find employment. The opinion specifically supports extending the deadline for initial interviews but opposes making it binding and removing the option for lighter initial contact. It also supports basing follow-up interviews on service needs but calls for this principle to apply more broadly. Helsinki strongly opposes the proposed mandatory creation and publication of jobseeker profiles by employment authorities if the jobseeker does not do it themselves, arguing it is an unnecessary administrative burden and that the quality of such profiles would be low, potentially hindering employer use. The city suggests alternative ways to provide employers access to jobseeker information. The opinion also comments on changes related to job offers, youth education obligations, unemployment benefit sanctions, and calls for broader reforms to the legislation to enable more effective, results-oriented, and locally tailored services, including piloting new service models and improving data utilization for service guidance and impact monitoring.

#### §192: Evaluation of the Implementation of the City Strategy 2021–2025
The City Board noted the evaluation report on the implementation of the City Strategy 2021–2025, titled "Kasvun paikka" (A Place for Growth). The evaluation was conducted as decided by the City Council when the strategy was approved. The report summarizes the progress and impacts of the strategy during the council term, based on data collected from various city departments, agencies, and municipal enterprises. It utilizes strategic indicators, other performance metrics, and statistical and research data from the city's urban data services. The evaluation also incorporated insights from previous mid-term reviews and assessments related to specific areas of city operations and strategy, such as the well-being barometer and sustainability assessments. The report was compiled by the City Executive Office's strategy department in collaboration with experts from different sectors and departments.

#### §193: Responding to Initiatives Submitted at the City Council Meeting on 12.3.2025
The City Board decided on how to respond to the 16 initiatives submitted at the City Council meeting on March 12, 2025. The initiatives were allocated to different city bodies for preparation of responses based on the administrative rules. Initiatives to be processed by the City Council (after City Board handling) include those regarding ending homelessness, terms of land use agreements, a park for hobbyhorses, lowering public transport ticket prices, a local pilot project for biodiversity protection, improving the clarity of salary slips, and upper limits for physical education group sizes. Initiatives to be handled by the City Board include one on integrating nature's health benefits into health services. Initiatives allocated to the Education and Training Committee concern updating daycare unit child capacities and preventing ultra-processed products in daycares and schools. Initiatives for the Urban Environment Committee relate to the placement and renewal of public waste bins for sorting and improving traffic arrangements at Vuosaari metro station bus terminal. An initiative for the Culture and Leisure Committee concerns establishing a larger library in Jätkäsaari.

Päätös Asia pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti Tuomas Rantasen ehdotuksesta.

#### § 187: V 16.4.2025, Mariantunnelin yleissuunnitelma

Kaupunginhallitus käsitteli Mariantunnelin yleissuunnitelmaa, joka on osa Länsibaanan pyöräliikenteen runkoverkkoa. Suunnitelma koskee jalankulku- ja pyörätunnelia, joka yhdistää ratakuilun Baanan ja Lapinlahdentien alueet Mechelininkadun alitse. Tunnelin pituus on noin 190 metriä, ja se parantaa pyöräilyn ja jalankulun sujuvuutta ja turvallisuutta alueella. Hankkeen kokonaiskustannusarvio on 18,5 miljoonaa euroa (alv 0 %, tammikuun 2024 kustannustaso). Rakentamisen on arvioitu kestävän 2–2,5 vuotta.

Päätös Asia pantiin pöydälle yksimielisesti Mika Raatikaisen ehdotuksesta.

#### § 188: Kaupungin viranomaisten päätösten seuraaminen

Kaupunginhallitus seurasi kaupungin muiden viranomaisten viikolla 12 tekemiä päätöksiä ja harkitsi otto-oikeuden käyttöä.

Päätös Kaupunginhallitus päätti jättää pöydälle otto-oikeusharkinnan kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan 18.3.2025 päätösten osalta. Muilta osin päätettiin, ettei käsiteltäväksi oteta asioita, joissa viranomaiset ovat tehneet päätöksen viikolla 12.

Vote Päätös hyväksyttiin yksimielisesti Paavo Arhinmäen ehdotuksesta.

#### § 189: V 18.6.2025, Helsingin kaupungin vuoden 2024 tilinpäätöksen hyväksyminen

Kaupunginhallitus esitti kaupunginvaltuustolle hyväksyttäväksi Helsingin kaupungin, kunta-Helsingin sekä sosiaali-, terveys- ja pelastustoimialan vuoden 2024 tilinpäätökset. Tilinpäätöksen mukaan Helsingin kaupungin tilikauden tulos ennen varausten ja rahastojen muutoksia oli 364,9 miljoonaa euroa. Kunta-Helsingin tulos oli 336,0 miljoonaa euroa ja sosiaali-, terveys- ja pelastustoimialan tulos 28,9 miljoonaa euroa. Tilinpäätösraportti antoi katsauksen kaupungin talouteen, väestönkasvuun, työllisyyteen, asuntotuotantoon ja investointeihin, sekä arvioi tulevaisuuden talousnäkymiä ja riskejä.

#### § 190: Tontin myyntiperiaatteiden määrittäminen asuinkerrostalotontille (Laajasalo, Kruunuvuorenranta, tontti 49291/2)

Kaupunginhallitus vahvisti myyntiperiaatteet Laajasalon Kruunuvuorenrannassa sijaitsevalle asuinkerrostalotontille 49291/2. Tontti on varattu Bonava Suomi Oy:lle vapaarahoitteista omistusasuntotuotantoa varten. Tontin pinta-ala on 1 438 m² ja asemakaavan mukainen rakennusoikeus 5 100 k-m². Myyntihinta perustuu yksikköhintoihin 1 143 euroa/k-m² asuintilan osalta ja 350 euroa/k-m² liiketilan osalta. Kauppahinnaksi muodostuu arviolta 6 148 464 euroa. Kauppahinta määräytyy vähintään asemakaavan mukaisen rakennusoikeuden mukaan, ja kaupungilla on oikeus periä lisäkauppahintaa, jos toteutettu kerrosala ylittää tämän.

#### § 191: Lausunto työnhakijan palveluprosessin ja työnvälityspalveluiden kehittämistä koskesta lainsäädännöstä

Kaupunginhallitus antoi lausunnon työ- ja elinkeinoministeriölle luonnoksesta hallituksen esitykseksi työnhakijan palveluprosessin ja työnvälityspalveluiden kehittämistä koskevaksi lainsäädännöksi. Helsinki kannatti tavoitetta palveluiden perustumisesta palvelutarpeeseen ja virkailijan harkintavallan lisäämisestä, mutta piti esitettyjä muutoksia liian vähäisinä ja osin kaavamaisuutta lisäävinä. Lausunnossa esitettiin useita tarkennuksia ja muutoksia, kuten alkuhaastattelun määräajan muuttaminen tavoitteelliseksi, tulorekisteritietojen laajemman hyödyntämisen mahdollistaminen, työvoimaviranomaisen velvollisuuden laatia työnhakuprofiili poistaminen sekä normien purkua, kuten yli 55-vuotiaiden muutosturvakoulutuksen lakkauttamista.

#### § 192: Kaupunkistrategian 2021–2025 toteutumisen arviointi

Kaupunginhallitus merkitsi tiedoksi Helsingin kaupunkistrategian 2021–2025 Kasvun paikka toteutumisen arvioinnin. Arviointiraportti on koottu eri lähteistä ja se sisältää katsauksen strategian toteutumiseen, oppeihin ja vaikuttavuuteen valtuustokauden aikana. Raporttia on käsitelty kaupunginvaltuuston seminaarissa helmikuussa 2025.

#### § 193: Kaupunginvaltuuston kokouksessa 12.3.2025 jätettyihin aloitteisiin vastaaminen

Kaupunginhallitus päätti, miten kaupunginvaltuuston kokouksessa 12.3.2025 jätettyihin 16 aloitteeseen vastataan. Aloitteet jaettiin vastattavaksi eri toimielimille: kaupunginhallitukselle (käsiteltäväksi valtuustossa tai omassa käsittelyssä), kasvatus- ja koulutuslautakunnalle, kaupunkiympäristölautakunnalle sekä kulttuuri- ja vapaa-aikalautakunnalle. Aloitteet koskivat monipuolisesti eri kaupungin toimialojen asioita asunnottomuudesta ja maankäytöstä koulutukseen, liikenteeseen ja kulttuuriin.

# Helsinki Urban Environment Committee Meeting Minutes from 18.03.2025

#### § 135: Announcements

The Urban Environment Committee decided to note the announcements. These included information about zoning amendments that have entered into force. Specifically, a zoning amendment for Sirrikuja 1 in Mellunkylä, approved by the committee on 14.1.2025, has become effective. Additionally, a zoning amendment concerning Haagan ympyrä and Vihdintie in Haaga and Pitäjänmäki, approved by the City Council on 30.8.2023, has also entered into force after appeals were rejected by the Administrative Court and the Supreme Administrative Court.

#### § 136: Port Tunnel Zoning and Zoning Amendment Proposal (No. 12957) and its Public Display (Includes Traffic Plan)

This agenda item concerned the zoning and zoning amendment proposal for the Port Tunnel project, which aims to improve traffic flow for port operations between Jätkäsaari and Länsiväylä and enable the development of the South Harbour area. The proposal includes underground spaces and integrates a main bicycle connection (Länsibaana). The plan is based on alignment option A, as option D was deemed to have significant schedule and cost risks due to its location over existing oil storage caves. The proposal was to place the plan publicly on display for 30 days and respond to feedback received during the interaction phase.

During the discussion, a proposal was made to return the item for preparation based on the alternative tunnel option D and to initiate preparation for the temporary relocation of Silja Line ships to the West Harbour. A separate counter-proposal requested that the next phase of planning include a socio-economic profitability assessment and funding calculations for the tunnel investment.

Vote 1: Continuation of processing vs. Return for preparation based on Option D and temporary ship relocation preparation.
Jaa (For continuation): 7
Ei (Against continuation/For return): 6
The committee decided to continue processing the item.

Vote 2: Approval of the presenter's proposal vs. Approval with the addition regarding profitability assessment and funding calculations.
Jaa (For presenter's proposal): 7
Ei (Against presenter's proposal/For addition): 6
The committee decided to approve the presenter's proposal.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to place the zoning and zoning amendment proposal publicly on display for 30 days and provide responses to feedback received.

#### § 137: Östersundom Partial Master Plan Draft

This item presented the draft partial master plan for the Östersundom area, aiming to enable a new district for approximately 35,000–45,000 residents and 4,000–6,000 jobs. The plan is based on a light rail connection from Itäkeskus and seeks to integrate new development with existing structures while preserving significant natural areas. The draft allocates roughly one-third of the area to nature reserves, one-third to recreation/outdoor areas, and one-third to construction. The area of protected nature is proposed to more than double. The plan includes areas for diverse housing types, local services along the light rail route, and employment areas near major roads.

Several counter-proposals and points were raised during the discussion, emphasizing the exceptional natural value of the area, particularly forests and recent fungi survey findings. These proposals called for adjusting construction and green area boundaries to protect valuable forests, expanding proposed nature reserves, accelerating small house construction, linking development to the vitality of Itäkeskus, ensuring sufficient local services like health centers, and exploring new sustainable concepts for integrating nature and construction.

Vote 1: Approval of the presenter's proposal vs. Approval with the addition regarding adjusting boundaries based on fungi surveys and expanding nature reserves.
Jaa (For presenter's proposal): 2
Ei (Against presenter's proposal/For addition): 11
The committee decided to approve the proposal as amended by the addition regarding nature values.

Vote 2: Approval of the proposal as amended by Vote 1 vs. Approval with the addition regarding accelerating small house construction.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Vote 1): 5
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Vote 1/For addition): 8
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding accelerating small house construction.

Vote 3: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2 vs. Approval with the addition regarding linking development to Itäkeskus vitality.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2): 2
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2/For addition): 11
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding linking development to Itäkeskus vitality.

Vote 4: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2 & 3 vs. Approval with the addition regarding focusing on local services like health centers.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2 & 3): 0
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2 & 3/For addition): 12
Tyhjä (Abstain): 1
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding local services.

Vote 5: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3 & 4 vs. Approval with the addition regarding exploring new concepts for sustainable development.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3 & 4): 1
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3 & 4/For addition): 12
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding new concepts.

Vote 6: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 vs. Approval with the addition regarding expanding nature reserves based on surveys and strengthening restoration measures.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5): 2
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5/For addition): 11
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding nature reserves and restoration.

Vote 7: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 vs. Approval with the addition regarding reconsidering housing type and density, focusing on infill and denser development near light rail.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6): 8
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6/For addition): 5
The committee decided to approve the presenter's proposal as amended by the previous votes.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to approve the Östersundom partial master plan draft as a basis for further planning, incorporating several additions related to nature preservation, development speed, service provision, and sustainable concepts.

#### § 138: Evaluation of the Lönnrotinkatu Studded Tire Ban Trial and Decision on Continuation

This item presented an evaluation of the studded tire ban trial on Lönnrotinkatu, which ran from autumn 2022 to spring 2025. The trial aimed to reduce harmful street dust levels, which exceed new EU limits. The current ban, allowing access for property visits, proved difficult to enforce, resulting in only a moderate decrease in studded tire use (from 70% to 45% on Lönnrotinkatu, and from 70% to 60% city-wide). While the trial had a slightly positive impact on air quality and dust, it was not effective enough to meet targets. The proposal was to continue the trial for three more years (autumn 2025 - spring 2028), removing the sign allowing access for property visits to make enforcement easier. This stricter ban is expected to increase compliance and improve air quality, although it may cause more traffic diversion and parking/service vehicle difficulties.

During the discussion, counter-proposals were made to investigate city-wide incentive measures (like reduced parking fees), expand the trial area to Runeberginkatu and potentially Kaisaniemenkatu, and advocate for legislation allowing a studded tire fee system. A proposal to reject the new trial entirely was made but did not receive support.

Vote 1: Approval of the presenter's proposal vs. Approval with the addition regarding investigating city-wide incentive measures.
Jaa (For presenter's proposal): 1
Ei (Against presenter's proposal/For addition): 11
The committee decided to approve the proposal as amended by the addition regarding incentive measures.

Vote 2: Approval of the proposal as amended by Vote 1 vs. Approval with the addition regarding expanding the trial area to Runeberginkatu and potentially Kaisaniemenkatu.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Vote 1): 6
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Vote 1/For addition): 6
The Chair's vote decided the outcome. The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding expanding the trial area.

Vote 3: Approval of the proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2 vs. Approval with the addition regarding advocating for legislation allowing a studded tire fee system.
Jaa (For proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2): 1
Ei (Against proposal as amended by Votes 1 & 2/For addition): 11
The committee decided to approve the proposal as further amended by the addition regarding advocating for legislation.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to approve the continuation of the studded tire ban trial on Lönnrotinkatu with stricter enforcement, incorporating additions to investigate city-wide incentives, expand the trial area, and advocate for legislative changes.

#### § 139: Proposal to City Board, Revised Zoning Amendment Proposal for the Government Palace (Snellmaninkatu 1) (Includes Traffic Principle Plan)

This item presented a revised zoning amendment proposal for the Government Palace complex. The goal is to allow the expansion of the palace with a modern administrative and office building in the inner courtyard to meet the needs of the central government, while preserving the historical exterior. The plan involves demolishing the former printing house building in the courtyard. The revised proposal includes a smaller, lower new building compared to a previous version, aiming to better fit the historical environment. The previous proposal was returned by the City Council for better consideration of historical values.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to table the item for two weeks.

#### § 140: Vuoranta (Ramsinranta IV), Zoning Amendment Proposal (No. 12960) and its Public Display (Includes Traffic Plan)

This item concerned a zoning amendment proposal for the Vuoranta area.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to remove the item from the agenda as the presenter withdrew the proposal.

#### § 141: Organizing a Concept Competition for Developing Haltiala Domestic Animal Farm and Selling Buildings (Tuomarinkylä)

This item proposed organizing a concept competition to find a new owner and developer for the Haltiala domestic animal farm. The aim is to transform the farm into an active and attractive recreation, visitor, and tourism area. The city intends to sell the farm's buildings and animals and lease the land to the competition winner. The competition is targeted at agricultural and tourism entrepreneurs with relevant experience. The proposal included a draft competition program outlining the objectives and criteria, such as including domestic animal activities, ensuring animal welfare, and preserving the area's historical and natural values.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to table the item.

#### § 142: Urban Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board on Mai Kivelä et al.'s Council Initiative Regarding Converting Haltiala Domestic Animal Farm into an Animal Shelter

This item concerned the Urban Environment Committee's draft statement on a council initiative proposing that the Haltiala domestic animal farm be converted into an animal shelter. The initiative highlighted the valuable work of existing animal shelters and the farm's current ethical practices. The city's draft statement noted that the Urban Environment sector is preparing a concept competition for the farm, which includes requirements for domestic animal activities and animal welfare, but does not specifically mandate an animal shelter. It also discussed the limitations on the city's ability to dictate the business model through a lease agreement, emphasizing that animal welfare laws apply to all operators.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to table the item.

#### § 143: Urban Environment Committee's Statement to the City Board on Councillor Otto Meri et al.'s Council Initiative Regarding Abandoning the Use of Calcium Chloride in the City's Winter Maintenance

This item presented the Urban Environment Committee's statement on a council initiative proposing that Helsinki abandon the use of calcium chloride in winter maintenance due to concerns about its effects on pets, particularly dogs' paws. The initiative also requested an investigation into its use in other cities and by private operators, and ways to reduce or replace its use. The city's statement explained that calcium chloride is used for enhanced winter maintenance on bicycle paths, limited ice prevention, and crucially for dust binding, which is essential for meeting air quality targets. A study found that while calcium chloride and other salts can irritate paws, especially in cold temperatures, severe issues have not been widely reported in Helsinki. The statement concluded that abandoning calcium chloride would significantly worsen the street dust problem and that effective alternatives for dust binding are needed. The city will investigate reducing its use in cold conditions and testing alternative materials.

The Urban Environment Committee gave the statement to the City Board.

#### § 144: Urban Environment Committee's Response to Councillor Laura Kolehmainen et al.'s Council Initiative Regarding Developing and/or Commissioning Life Cycle Assessment by an Impartial Party

This item concerned the Urban Environment Committee's response to a council initiative proposing the development of unified guidelines for life cycle assessments (LCA) in construction projects and considering requiring these assessments to be conducted by impartial parties, particularly for projects involving demolition and new construction. The initiative highlighted concerns that developers with an interest in new construction might produce LCAs that favor demolition over renovation. The city's response explained that Helsinki already uses LCA for carbon footprint assessment in new residential buildings and is aligning with new national legislation. It acknowledged that the accuracy of external LCAs depends on the quality of input data and that clearer guidelines for assumptions, scope, and reporting are needed, especially for demolition sites.

During the discussion, a counter-proposal was made to add a requirement that the city explicitly begin preparing a clear guideline to ensure the quality and accuracy of input data for LCAs, particularly for demolition sites, and to guide the commissioning of these assessments.

Vote: Approval of the presenter's proposal vs. Approval with the addition regarding preparing a clear guideline for LCA input data and guidance for demolition sites.
Jaa (For presenter's proposal): 3
Ei (Against presenter's proposal/For addition): 7
Tyhjä (Abstain): 2
The committee decided to approve the proposal as amended by the addition regarding preparing a guideline for LCAs.

The Urban Environment Committee considered the council initiative concluded, incorporating the decision to prepare a guideline for life cycle assessments.

#### § 145: Decision on the Price Competition for Three Small House Plots (AP) in Kuninkaantammi, Approval of the Preliminary Real Estate Purchase Agreement, and Sale of the Plots (Kuninkaantammi, Indicative Plots 33401/1–3)

This item concerned the sale of three indicative plots (33401/1, 2, and 3) in Kuninkaantammi, designated for semi-detached and terraced houses. A price competition was held, but only one bidder, Olas Group Oy, submitted offers for two of the three plots. Following the competition, negotiations were held with Olas Group Oy to raise the price to market level and include the third plot. An agreement was reached to sell all three plots to Olas Group Oy for a total price of at least €1,650,000, with the sale to be conducted in phases. The first plot will be sold by the end of 2025, and the remaining two by May 2027.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to sell the plots to Olas Group Oy based on the price competition and subsequent negotiations, approving the preliminary real estate purchase agreement and authorizing necessary adjustments to the agreements.

#### § 146: Re-leasing of a Hotel and Restaurant Plot to Norgani 1 Ab Oy (Munkkiniemi, Plot 30003/2)

This item concerned the re-leasing of plot 30003/2 in Munkkiniemi, currently leased to Norgani 1 Ab Oy and housing part of the Hilton Kalastajatorppa hotel. The current lease expires at the end of 2025. The proposal was to re-lease the plot to the same company for a period until 31.12.2054 for hotel and restaurant operations, in accordance with the existing zoning and the city's land lease policies. The new annual rent was proposed based on the market value of the building right and the city's target yield.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to re-lease the plot to Norgani 1 Ab Oy until 31.12.2054 under the proposed terms and note the termination of the current lease.

#### § 147: Land Exchange with the Helsinki Parish Union

This item concerned a proposed land exchange between the City of Helsinki and the Helsinki Parish Union. The city would transfer a approximately 25,000 m² area in Östersundom, adjacent to the chapel and cemetery, which is planned for cemetery expansion in the draft partial master plan. The Parish Union would transfer a approximately 69,148 m² property in Herttoniemi, which is designated for municipal technical services (specifically, a snow disposal area) in a pending zoning amendment. The city would pay a difference amount to the Parish Union. Negotiations resulted in agreed values for the exchanged properties and a difference payment of €1,343,169 from the city to the Parish Union.

The Urban Environment Committee decided to approve the land exchange with the Helsinki Parish Union under the proposed terms and authorize the signing of the exchange agreement.

#### § 148: Urban Environment Committee's Proposal to the City Board to Reserve a Commercial and Office Plot (K) for Suomen Lions-liitto ry for Housing Planning (Malmi, Plot 38118/9)

This item presented the Urban Environment Committee's proposal to the City Board regarding the reservation of plot 38118/9 in Malmi for Suomen Lions-liitto ry. The plot is currently zoned for commercial and office use and leased to Lions-liitto until 2045. Lions-liitto requested the reservation for planning unregulated market-rate owner-occupied housing, which would require a zoning amendment. The city's policy allows direct reservations for existing long-term leaseholders for infill development projects. The proposal is to reserve the plot until 31.12.2026 for this planning purpose. The plot is located in an urban renewal area, and the planned project aligns with the city's strategy for sustainable growth and infill development along rail lines. The plot is intended to be sold later.

The Urban Environment Committee proposed to the City Board that the plot be reserved for Suomen Lions-liitto ry for housing planning under the specified conditions.

#### § 149: Urban Environment Committee's Proposal to the City Board to Amend the Administrative Regulation Due to Changes in the Building Act etc.

This item presented the Urban Environment Committee's proposal to the City Board to amend the city's administrative regulation. The amendments are necessary to align the regulation with changes

# Helsingin Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan Pöytäkirja 18.03.2025

#### § 135: Ilmoitusasiat

Kaupunkiympäristölautakunta merkitsi tiedoksi ilmoitusasiat. Näihin sisältyivät tiedot voimaan tulleista asemakaavoista Mellunkylässä (Sirrikuja 1) ja Haagassa/Pitäjänmäessä (Haagan ympyrä ja Vihdintie). Haagan/Pitäjänmäen asemakaavan muutoksen voimaantulo oli viivästynyt valitusten vuoksi, jotka hallinto-oikeus ja korkein hallinto-oikeus olivat hylänneet.

#### § 136: Satamatunnelin asemakaava- ja asemakaavan muutosehdotus (nro 12957) ja sen asettaminen nähtäville (sisältää liikennesuunnitelman)

Asemakaava- ja asemakaavan muutosehdotus koskee Länsisataman ja Kampin alueita ja mahdollistaa satamaliikenteen tunnelin rakentamisen Jätkäsaaren ja Länsiväylän välille. Ehdotus perustuu kaupunginvaltuuston periaatepäätökseen satamatoimintojen uudelleenjärjestelystä ja pyrkii parantamaan satamaliikenteen sujuvuutta ja vapauttamaan Eteläsataman alueita muuhun käyttöön. Kaavaratkaisuun sisältyy myös pyöräliikenteen pääyhteys (Länsibaana) tunnelin pohjoisen suuaukon yhteyteen. Valmistelussa on huomioitu ympäristövaikutusten arviointi ja pyritty minimoimaan vaikutukset Lapinlahden puistoon ja sen luonto- ja kulttuuriarvoihin. Ehdotus perustuu YVA-vaiheen linjausvaihtoehtoon A, koska vaihtoehto D:hen liittyisi merkittäviä aikataulu- ja kustannusriskejä öljyvarastoluolien vuoksi.

Käsittelyn aikana esitettiin palautusehdotus (Anni Sinnemäki), joka olisi palauttanut kaavan valmisteluun tarkastellun tunnelivaihtoehdon D pohjalta ja käynnistänyt valmistelun Silja Linen laivapaikan väliaikaisesta siirrosta Jätkäsaareen. Esitettiin myös vastaehdotuksia (Mia Haglund, Otto Meri) koskien kannattavuusarviointia, rahoituslaskelmia, kokeilualueen laajentamista ja nastarengasmaksujärjestelmän mahdollistamista lainsäädännössä.

#### § 137: Östersundomin osayleiskaavaluonnos

Östersundomin osayleiskaavaluonnos kattaa koko suurpiirin ja osan Mustavuoren aluetta, mahdollistaen noin 35 000–45 000 asukkaan kaupunginosan ja noin 4 000–6 000 työpaikkaa. Luonnos perustuu suunnitteluperiaatteisiin, mutta uudet luontoselvitykset, kuten kääpäkartoitukset, ovat täydentäneet tietoa alueen arvokkaasta luonnosta.

Käsittelyn aikana esitettiin useita vastaehdotuksia ja lisäyksiä päätösehdotukseen, jotka koskivat luontoarvojen parempaa huomioimista kaavaehdotusvaiheessa (Anni Sinnemäki, Mia Haglund), pientaloalueiden kaavoituksen nopeuttamista (Risto Rautava), alueen toteuttamisen sitomista Itäkeskuksen kehittymiseen (Sami Kuusela), lähipalveluihin panostamista (Sami Kuusela) sekä uudenlaisten konseptien ja toteuttamismallien etsimistä (Sami Kuusela, Mia Haglund).

#### § 138: Lönnrotinkadun nastarengaskieltokokeilun vaikutusten arviointi ja jatkosta päättäminen

Helsingin tavoitteena on vähentää nastarenkaiden osuutta katupölyn ja terveyshaittojen vähentämiseksi. Lönnrotinkadulla on ollut nastarengaskieltokokeilu vuodesta 2022, mutta kiinteistöissä asioinnin sallinut lisäkilpi on tehnyt valvonnasta vaikeaa ja kiellosta vähemmän tehokkaan. Nastarenkaiden osuus on laskenut kadulla 70 %:sta noin 45 %:iin, mutta tämä ei ole riittänyt uusien EU:n hiukkasraja-arvojen saavuttamiseksi. Tehokkaimmat keinot nastarenkaiden vähentämiseen olisivat katukohtaiset kiellot ilman poikkeuksia tai nastarengasmaksut, joita lainsäädäntö ei tällä hetkellä mahdollista.

Hylkäysehdotus (Mika Raatikainen) raukesi kannattamattomana.

#### § 141: Konseptikilpailun järjestäminen Haltialan kotieläintilan kehittämiseksi ja rakennusten myymiseksi (Tuomarinkylä)

Kaupunkiympäristön toimiala valmistelee Haltialan kotieläintilan toiminnan siirtämistä yrittäjävetoiseksi ja luopumista kaupungin omasta toiminnasta. Tavoitteena on järjestää konseptikilpailu, jolla etsitään uusi omistaja ja kehittäjä Haltialan tilalle, sen rakennuksille ja eläimille. Kilpailun kautta pyritään kehittämään alueesta monipuolisempi virkistys-, vierailu- ja matkailualue. Kilpailu on suunnattu maatalous- ja matkailualan yrittäjille, ja sen ratkaisu perustuu konseptiehdotukseen, joka arvioidaan kävijäkokemuksen, alueen arvojen vaalimisen sekä toteutettavuuden perusteella. Rakennukset ja maa-alueet myydään/vuokrataan kiinteään, markkinahintaan perustuvaan hintaan.

Kilpailun arviointikriteereissä edellytetään kotieläintoimintaa, asianmukaisia eläinten pito-olosuhteita ja eläinten hyvinvoinnin huomioimista. Eläinsuojelukeskuksen perustamista ei suoraan edellytetä, mutta sitä ei myöskään suljeta pois, jos se täyttää muut kilpailun vaatimukset. Kaupunki ei voi merkittävästi puuttua tulevan yrittäjän liiketoiminnan yksityiskohtiin vapaan kilpailun vuoksi, mutta eläinten hyvinvointilaki velvoittaa kaikkia toimijoita.

#### § 143: Kaupunkiympäristölautakunnan lausunto kaupunginhallitukselle valtuutettu Otto Meren ym. valtuustoaloitteesta koskien kalsiumkloridin käytöstä luopumista kaupungin talvikunnossapidossa

Valtuustoaloitteessa esitetään kalsiumkloridin käytön kieltämistä kaupungin talvikunnossapidossa sen lemmikeille aiheuttamien haittojen vuoksi. Helsingissä kalsiumkloridia käytetään tehostettujen pyöräteiden talvikunnossapidossa harjasuolauksella, vähäisessä määrin liukkaudentorjunnassa (esim. mustan jään torjuntaan) sekä keväisin katupölyn sitomiseen. Selvityksen mukaan kalsiumkloridi voi ärsyttää koiran tassuja, erityisesti kylmällä säällä, mutta vakavia haittoja ei ole raportoitu laajasti. Kalsiumkloridi on tehokas pölynsidonta-aine, ja sen käytön lopettaminen pahentaisi katupölyongelmaa. Kaupunki aikoo vähentää kalsiumkloridin käyttöä tarkistamalla ohjeistuksia ja testaamalla vaihtoehtoisia materiaaleja, erityisesti pakkasella.
